verses.textEn: And you shall fasten it with a band of hyacinth, and it shall be upon the headdress,
verses.textLa: Ligabisque eam vitta hyacinthina, et erit super tiaram,

verses.textEn: hanging in front of the high priest. And Aaron shall carry the iniquities of that which the sons of Israel have offered and sanctified, in all their gifts and donations. But the plate will always be at his forehead, so that the Lord may be well pleased with them.
verses.textLa: imminens fronti pontificis. Portabitque Aaron iniquitates eorum, quæ obtulerunt et sanctificaverunt filii Israel, in cunctis muneribus et donariis suis. Erit autem lamina semper in fronte eius, ut placatus sit eis Dominus.

verses.textEn: And you shall draw the tunic tight with fine linen, and you shall make a headdress of fine linen, and a wide belt, wrought with embroidery.
verses.textLa: Stringesque tunicam bysso, et tiaram byssinam facies, et balteum opere plumarii.

verses.textEn: Furthermore, for the sons of Aaron, you shall prepare linen tunics, and wide belts as well as headdresses, with glory and elegance.
verses.textLa: Porro filiis Aaron tunicas lineas parabis et balteos ac tiaras in gloriam et decorem:

verses.textEn: And with all these you shall vest your brother Aaron, and his sons with him. And you shall consecrate all their hands, and you shall sanctify them, so that they may exercise the priesthood for me.
verses.textLa: vestiesque his omnibus Aaron fratrem tuum et filios eius cum eo. Et cunctorum consecrabis manus, sanctificabisque illos, ut sacerdotio fungantur mihi.

verses.textEn: You shall also make linen undergarments, in order to cover the flesh of their nakedness, from the kidneys all the way to the thighs.
verses.textLa: Facies et feminalia linea, ut operiant carnem turpitudinis suæ, a renibus usque ad femora:

verses.textEn: And Aaron and his sons will use them when they enter the tabernacle of the testimony, and when they approach toward the altar, in order to minister in the sanctuary, lest, being guilty of iniquity, they may die. It shall be a law forever for Aaron, and for his offspring after him.”
verses.textLa: et utentur eis Aaron et filii eius quando ingredientur tabernaculum testimonii, vel quando appropinquant ad altare ut ministrent in sanctuario, ne iniquitatis rei moriantur. Legitimum sempiternum erit Aaron, et semini eius post eum.

verses.textEn: “But you shall also do this, so that they may be consecrated to me in the priesthood: Take a calf from the herd, and two immaculate rams,
verses.textLa: Sed et hoc facies, ut mihi in sacerdotio consecrentur. Tolle vitulum de armento, et arietes duos immaculatos,

verses.textEn: and unleavened bread, and a crust without leaven that has been sprinkled with oil, likewise, unleavened cakes smeared with oil. You shall make them all from the same wheat flour.
verses.textLa: panesque azymos, et crustulam absque fermento, quæ conspersa sit oleo, lagana quoque azyma oleo lita: de simila triticea cuncta facies.

verses.textEn: And, having placed them in baskets, you shall offer them, along with the calf and the two rams.
verses.textLa: Et posita in canistro offeres: vitulum autem et duos arietes.

verses.textEn: And you shall bring forward Aaron and his sons, to the door of the tabernacle of the testimony. And when you will have washed the father with his sons in water,
verses.textLa: Et Aaron, ac filios eius applicabis ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii. Cumque laveris patrem cum filiis suis aqua,

verses.textEn: you shall clothe Aaron in his vestments, that is, with the linen, and the tunic, and the ephod, and the breastplate, which you shall draw together with the wide belt.
verses.textLa: indues Aaron vestimentis suis, id est, linea et tunica, et superhumerali et rationali, quod constringes balteo.

verses.textEn: And you shall place the headdress on his head and the holy plate upon the headdress.
verses.textLa: Et pones tiaram in capite eius, et laminam sanctam super tiaram,

verses.textEn: And you shall pour the oil of unction over his head. And so, by this rite, he shall be consecrated.
verses.textLa: et oleum unctionis fundes super caput eius: atque hoc ritu consecrabitur.

verses.textEn: Likewise, you shall bring forward his sons, and you shall clothe them in the linen tunics, and wrap them with the wide belt:
verses.textLa: Filios quoque illius applicabis, et indues tunicis lineis, cingesque balteo,

verses.textEn: Aaron, certainly, as well as his sons. And you shall impose headdresses upon them. And they shall be priests to me by a perpetual ordinance. After you have initiated their hands,
verses.textLa: Aaron scilicet et liberos eius, et impones eis mitras: eruntque sacerdotes mihi religione perpetua. Postquam initiaveris manus eorum,

verses.textEn: you shall bring forward also the calf, in the presence of the tabernacle of the testimony. And Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands upon its head.
verses.textLa: applicabis et vitulum coram tabernaculo testimonii. Imponentque Aaron et filii eius manus super caput illius,

verses.textEn: And you shall sacrifice it in the sight of the Lord, beside the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: et mactabis eum in conspectu Domini, iuxta ostium tabernaculi testimonii.

verses.textEn: And taking some of the blood of the calf, you shall place it upon the horns of the altar with your finger, but the remainder of the blood you shall pour next to its base.
verses.textLa: Sumptumque de sanguine vituli, pones super cornua altaris digito tuo, reliquum autem sanguinem fundes iuxta basim eius.

verses.textEn: And you shall take all the fat which covers its intestines, and the mesh of the liver, as well as the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, and you shall offer them as a burnt offering upon the altar.
verses.textLa: Sumes et adipem totum qui operit intestina, et reticulum iecoris, ac duos renes, et adipem qui super eos est, et offeres incensum super altare:

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the flesh of the calf, and the hide and the dung, you shall burn outside, beyond the camp, because it is for sin.
verses.textLa: carnes vero vituli et corium et fimum combures foris extra castra, eo quod pro peccato sit.

verses.textEn: Likewise, you shall take one ram, and upon its head Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands.
verses.textLa: Unum quoque arietem sumes, super cuius caput ponent Aaron et filii eius manus.

verses.textEn: And when you will have sacrificed it, you shall take from its blood and pour it around the altar.
verses.textLa: Quem cum mactaveris, tolles de sanguine eius, et fundes circa altare.

verses.textEn: Then you shall cut the ram into pieces, and, having washed its intestines and feet, you shall place these upon the cut-up flesh and upon its head.
verses.textLa: Ipsum autem arietem secabis in frustra: lotaque intestina eius ac pedes pones super concisas carnes, et super caput illius.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer the entire ram as a burnt offering upon the altar. It is an oblation to the Lord, a most sweet odor of the victim of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et offeres totum arietem in incensum super altare: oblatio est Domino, odor suavissimus victimæ Domini.

verses.textEn: Likewise, you shall take the other ram, upon whose head Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands.
verses.textLa: Tolles quoque arietem alterum, super cuius caput Aaron et filii eius ponent manus.

verses.textEn: And when you will have immolated it, you shall take of its blood, and place it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron and his sons, and on the thumbs and big toes of their right hand and right foot, and you shall pour the blood upon the altar, all around.
verses.textLa: Quem cum immolaveris, sumes de sanguine eius, et pones super extremum auriculæ dextræ Aaron et filiorum eius, et super pollices manus eorum ac pedis dextri, fundesque sanguinem super altare per circuitum.

verses.textEn: And when you have taken from the blood that is on the altar, and from the oil of unction, you shall sprinkle Aaron and his vestment, his sons and their vestments. And after they and their vestments have been consecrated,
verses.textLa: Cumque tuleris de sanguine qui est super altare, et de oleo unctionis, asperges Aaron et vestes eius, filios et vestimenta eorum. Consecratisque ipsis et vestibus,

verses.textEn: you shall take the fat of the ram, and the rump, and the lard that covers the internal organs, and the mesh of the liver, and the two kidneys along with the fat that is on them, and the right shoulder, because it is the ram of consecration,
verses.textLa: tolles adipem de ariete, et caudam et arvinam, quæ operit vitalia, ac reticulum iecoris, et duos renes, atque adipem, qui super eos est, armumque dextrum, eo quod sit aries consecrationis:

verses.textEn: and one turn of bread, a crust sprinkled with oil, and a cake from the basket of unleavened bread, which was placed in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: tortamque panis unius, crustulam conspersam oleo, laganum de canistro azymorum, quod positum est in conspectu Domini:

verses.textEn: And you shall place all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons, and you shall sanctify them, lifting them up in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: ponesque omnia super manus Aaron et filiorum eius, et sanctificabis eos elevans coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And you shall take all these things from their hands and burn them upon the altar as a holocaust, as a most sweet odor in the sight of the Lord, because it is his oblation.
verses.textLa: Suscipiesque universa de manibus eorum: et incendes super altare in holocaustum, odorem suavissimum in conspectu Domini, quia oblatio eius est.

verses.textEn: Likewise, you shall take the chest of the ram, with which Aaron was initiated, and you shall sanctify it, lifting it up in the sight of the Lord, and it will fall to your share.
verses.textLa: Sumes quoque pectusculum de ariete, quo initiatus est Aaron, sanctificabisque illud elevatum coram Domino, et cedet in partem tuam.

verses.textEn: And you shall sanctify both the consecrated chest and the shoulder that you separated from the ram,
verses.textLa: Sanctificabisque et pectusculum consecratum, et armum quem de ariete separasti,

verses.textEn: with which Aaron was initiated with his sons, and these will fall to the share of Aaron and his sons, as a perpetual oath by the sons of Israel. For these are the greatest and the first of their victims of peace, which they offer to the Lord.
verses.textLa: quo initiatus est Aaron et filii eius, cedentque in partem Aaron et filiorum eius iure perpetuo a filiis Israel: quia primitiva sunt et initia de victimis eorum pacificis quæ offerunt Domino.

verses.textEn: But the holy vestment, which Aaron shall use, his sons shall possess after him, so that they may be anointed in it and their hands may be consecrated.
verses.textLa: Vestem autem sanctam, qua utetur Aaron, habebunt filii eius post eum, ut ungantur in ea, et consecrantur manus eorum.

verses.textEn: For seven days, he who is high priest in his place and who enters the tabernacle of the testimony to minister in the Sanctuary shall use it.
verses.textLa: Septem diebus utetur illa qui pontifex pro eo fuerit constitutus de filiis eius, et qui ingredietur tabernaculum testimonii ut ministret in Sanctuario.

verses.textEn: But you shall take the ram of consecration and cook its flesh in the holy place.
verses.textLa: Arietem autem consecrationis tolles, et coques carnes eius in loco sancto:

verses.textEn: And Aaron and his sons shall feed on it. Likewise, the loaves which are in the basket, they shall consume in the vestibule of the tabernacle of the testimony,
verses.textLa: quibus vescetur Aaron et filii eius. Panes quoque, qui sunt in canistro, in vestibulo tabernaculi testimonii comedent,

verses.textEn: so that it may be an appeasing sacrifice, and so that the hands of those who offer may be sanctified. A stranger shall not eat from these, for they are holy.
verses.textLa: ut sit placabile sacrificium, et sanctificentur offerentium manus. Alienigena non vescetur ex eis, quia sancti sunt.

verses.textEn: And what may remain until morning, of the consecrated flesh or of the bread, you shall burn these remnants with fire. These shall not be eaten, because they have been sanctified.
verses.textLa: Quod si remanserit de carnibus consecratis, sive de panibus usque mane, combures reliquias igni: non comedentur, quia sanctificata sunt.

verses.textEn: All that I have instructed you concerning Aaron and his sons, you shall do. For seven days shall you consecrate their hands,
verses.textLa: Omnia, quæ præcepi tibi, facies super Aaron et filiis eius. Septem diebus consecrabis manus eorum:

verses.textEn: and you shall offer a calf for sin on each day, as an atonement. And you shall cleanse the altar when you will have immolated the victim of expiation, and you shall anoint it for sanctification.
verses.textLa: et vitulum pro peccato offeres per singulos dies ad expiandum. Mundabisque altare cum immolaveris expiationis hostiam, et unges illud in sanctificationem.

verses.textEn: For seven days, you shall expiate and sanctify the altar, and it shall be the Holy of holies. All those who will touch it must be sanctified.
verses.textLa: Septem diebus expiabis altare, et sanctificabis, et erit Sanctum sanctorum: omnis, qui tetigerit illud, sanctificabitur.

verses.textEn: This is what you shall acquire for the altar: Two one-year-old lambs, each day continually,
verses.textLa: Hoc est quod facies in altari: Agnos anniculos duos per singulos dies iugiter,

verses.textEn: one lamb in the morning, and the other in the evening;
verses.textLa: unum agnum mane, et alterum vespere,

verses.textEn: for the one lamb, a tenth part of fine flour sprinkled with crushed oil, which shall have the measure of the fourth part of a hin, and wine for a libation, of the same measure;
verses.textLa: decimam partem similæ conspersæ oleo tuso, quod habeat mensuram quartam partem hin, et vinum ad libandum eiusdem mensuræ in agno uno.
verses.notes: A hin was about 6 liters; a fourth part of a ‘hin’ is about 1.5 liters.

verses.textEn: truly, the other lamb you shall offer in the evening, according to the ritual of the morning oblation, and according to what we have said, as an odor of sweetness.
verses.textLa: Alterum vero agnum offeres ad vesperam iuxta ritum matutinæ oblationis, et iuxta ea quæ diximus, in odorem suavitatis:

verses.textEn: It is a sacrifice to the Lord, by a perpetual oblation among your generations, at the door of the tabernacle of the testimony before the Lord, where I resolve to speak to you.
verses.textLa: sacrificium est Domino, oblatione perpetua in generationes vestras, ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii coram Domino, ubi constituam ut loquar ad te.

verses.textEn: And there I will instruct the sons of Israel, and the altar shall be sanctified by my glory.
verses.textLa: Ibique præcipiam filiis Israel, et sanctificabitur altare in gloria mea.

verses.textEn: I will also sanctify the tabernacle of the testimony with the altar, and Aaron with his sons, to exercise the priesthood for me.
verses.textLa: Sanctificabo et tabernaculum testimonii cum altari, et Aaron cum filiis suis, ut sacerdotio fungantur mihi.

verses.textEn: And I will live in the midst of the sons of Israel, and I will be their God.
verses.textLa: Et habitabo in medio filiorum Israel, eroque eis Deus,

verses.textEn: And they shall know that I am the Lord their God, who led them away from the land of Egypt, so that I might dwell among them. I am the Lord their God.”
verses.textLa: et scient quia ego Dominus Deus eorum, qui eduxi eos de Terra Ægypti, ut manerem inter illos, ego Dominus Deus ipsorum.

verses.textEn: “You shall also make an altar, for the burning of incense, from setim wood,
verses.textLa: Facies quoque altare ad adolendum thymiama, de lignis setim,

verses.textEn: having one cubit in length, and another in width, that is, four equal sides, and two cubits in height. Horns shall proceed from the same.
verses.textLa: habens cubitum longitudinis, et alterum latitudinis, id est, quadrangulum, et duos cubitos in altitudine. Cornua ex ipso procedent.

verses.textEn: And you shall clothe it with the purest gold, both its grating and the walls around it, and also the horns. And you shall make for it a crown of gold in a circle,
verses.textLa: Vestiesque illud auro purissimo, tam craticulam eius, quam parietes per circuitum, et cornua. Faciesque ei coronam aureolam per gyrum,

verses.textEn: and two gold rings under the crown on each side, so that the bars may be set in them and the altar may be carried.
verses.textLa: et duos annulos aureos sub corona per singula latera, ut mittantur in eos vectes, et altare portetur.

verses.textEn: Also, you shall make its bars of setim wood, and you shall overlay them with gold.
verses.textLa: Ipsos quoque vectes facies de lignis setim, et inaurabis.

verses.textEn: And you shall set the altar opposite the veil, which hangs in front of the ark of the testimony, before the propitiatory with which the testimony is covered, where I will speak to you.
verses.textLa: Ponesque altare contra velum, quod ante arcum pendet testimonii coram propitiatorio quo tegitur testimonium, ubi loquar tibi.

verses.textEn: And Aaron shall burn incense upon it, a sweet fragrance, in the morning. When he lights the lamps, he shall burn it.
verses.textLa: Et adolebit incensum super eo Aaron, suave fragrans, mane. Quando componet lucernas, incendet illud:

verses.textEn: And when he assembles them in the evening, he shall burn an everlasting incense before the Lord throughout your generations.
verses.textLa: et quando collocabit eas ad vesperum, uret thymiama sempiternum coram Domino in generationes vestras.

verses.textEn: You shall not offer upon it incense of another composition, nor an oblation, nor a victim; neither shall you offer libations.
verses.textLa: Non offeretis super eo thymiama compositionis alterius, nec oblationem, et victimam, nec libabitis libamina.

verses.textEn: And Aaron shall pray over its horns once a year, with the blood of what was offered for sin. And he shall make atonement over it in your generations. It shall be the Holy of holies to the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Et deprecabitur Aaron super cornua eius semel per annum, in sanguine quod oblatum est pro peccato, et placabit super eo in generationibus vestris. Sanctum sanctorum erit Domino.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “When you have taken the sum of the sons of Israel, according to their number, each shall give a price for their souls to the Lord, and there will be no scourge among them, when they will be reviewed.
verses.textLa: Quando tuleris summam filiorum Israel iuxta numerum, dabunt singuli pretium pro animabus suis Domino, et non erit plaga in eis, cum fuerint recensiti.

verses.textEn: Then all those who pass shall give by name: one half shekel, according to the measure at the temple. A shekel has twenty obols. The half part of a shekel shall be offered to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Hoc autem dabit omnis qui transit ad nomen, dimidium sicli iuxta mensuram templi. Siclus viginti obolos habet. Media pars sicli offeretur Domino.
verses.notes: An obol is a coin (and a unit of weight) worth one sixth of a drachma.

verses.textEn: He who has been numbered from twenty years and above shall give the price.
verses.textLa: Qui habetur in numero, a viginti annis et supra, dabit pretium.

verses.textEn: The rich shall not add to the half shekel, and the poor shall diminish nothing.
verses.textLa: Dives non addet ad medium sicli, et pauper nihil minuet.

verses.textEn: And the money received, which was collected from the sons of Israel, you shall deliver for the uses of the tabernacle of the testimony, so that it may be a memorial of them before the Lord, and he may act favorably toward their souls.”
verses.textLa: Susceptamque pecuniam, quæ collata est a filiis Israel, trades in usus tabernaculi testimonii, ut sit monimentum eorum coram Domino, et propitietur animabus eorum.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “You shall also make a bronze washtub with its base to wash in; and you shall place it between the tabernacle of the testimony and the altar. And when water has been added,
verses.textLa: Facies et labrum æneum cum basi sua ad lavandum: ponesque illud inter tabernaculum testimonii et altare. Et missa aqua,

verses.textEn: Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and feet in it:
verses.textLa: lavabunt in ea Aaron, et filii eius manus suas ac pedes,

verses.textEn: when they enter the tabernacle of the testimony, and when they approach to the altar so as to offer incense to the Lord upon it,
verses.textLa: quando ingressuri sunt tabernaculum testimonii, et quando accessuri sunt ad altare, ut offerant in eo thymiama Domino,

verses.textEn: otherwise, they may die. This shall be an everlasting law to him, and to his offspring, throughout their successions.”
verses.textLa: ne forte moriantur. Legitimum sempiternum erit ipsi, et semini eius per successiones.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen,

verses.textEn: saying: “Take for yourself aromatics: of the first and best myrrh, five hundred shekels, and of cinnamon half as much, that is, two hundred and fifty shekels; of sweet flag similarly two hundred and fifty,
verses.textLa: dicens: Sume tibi aromata, primæ myrrhæ et electæ quingentos siclos, et cinnamomi medium, id est, ducentos quinquaginta siclos, calami similiter ducentos quinquaginta,
verses.notes: A shekel, and in general other units of money at that time, were units of weight. A shekel was about 11.5 grams.

verses.textEn: but of cassia, five hundred shekels by the weight of the sanctuary, and of the oil of olives the measure of a hin.
verses.textLa: casiæ autem quingentos siclos in pondere sanctuarii, olei de olivetis mensuram hin:

verses.textEn: And you shall make the holy oil of unction, an ointment composed with the skills of a perfumer,
verses.textLa: faciesque unctionis oleum sanctum, unguentum compositum opere unguentarii,

verses.textEn: and with it you shall anoint the tabernacle of the testimony, and the ark of the testament,
verses.textLa: et unges ex eo tabernaculum testimonii, et arcam testamenti,

verses.textEn: and the table with its vessels, and the lampstand and its utensils, the altars of incense
verses.textLa: mensamque cum vasis suis, et candelabrum, et utensilia eius, altaria thymiamatis,

verses.textEn: and of holocaust, and all the items that pertain to their rituals.
verses.textLa: et holocausti, et universam supellectilem quæ ad cultum eorum pertinet.

verses.textEn: And you shall sanctify everything, and they shall be the Holy of holies. He who will touch them must be sanctified.
verses.textLa: Sanctificabisque omnia, et erunt Sancta sanctorum: qui tetigerit ea, sanctificabitur.

verses.textEn: You shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and you shall sanctify them, so that they may exercise the priesthood for me.
verses.textLa: Aaron et filios eius unges, sanctificabisque eos, ut sacerdotio fungantur mihi.

verses.textEn: Likewise, you shall say to the sons of Israel: ‘This oil of unction will be holy to me throughout your generations.
verses.textLa: Filiis quoque Israel dices: Hoc oleum unctionis sanctum erit mihi in generationes vestras.

verses.textEn: The flesh of man shall not be anointed from it, and you shall not make any similar compound, for it has been sanctified and it shall be holy to you.
verses.textLa: Caro hominis non ungetur ex eo, et iuxta compositionem eius non facietis aliud, quia sanctificatum est, et sanctum erit vobis.

verses.textEn: Whatever man will have composed such a thing and have given it to a stranger, he shall be exterminated from his people.’ ”
verses.textLa: Homo quicumque tale composuerit, et dederit ex eo, alieno, exterminabitur de populo suo.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses: “Take to yourself aromatics: stacte, and onycha, galbanum of sweet odor, and the clearest frankincense, all these shall be of equal weight.
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Sume tibi aromata, stacten et onycha, galbanum boni odoris, et thus lucidissimum, æqualis ponderis erunt omnia:

verses.textEn: And you shall make incense composed with the skills of a perfumer, diligently mixed, and pure, and most worthy of sanctification.
verses.textLa: faciesque thymiama compositum opere unguentarii, mistum diligenter, et purum, et sanctificatione dignissimum.
verses.notes: The word ‘unguentarii’ refers to someone who composes ointments, including those for health and those for beauty.

verses.textEn: And when you have crushed all these into a very fine powder, you shall place some of it before the tabernacle of the testimony, in the place where I will appear to you. The Holy of holies shall this incense be to you.
verses.textLa: Cumque in tenuissimum pulverem universa contuderis, pones ex eo coram tabernaculo testimonii, in quo loco apparebo tibi. Sanctum sanctorum erit vobis thymiama.

verses.textEn: You shall not make such a compound for your own uses, because it is holy to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Talem compositionem non facietis in usus vestros, quia sanctum est Domino.

verses.textEn: Whatever man will have made anything similar, so as to thoroughly enjoy its smell, he shall perish from his people.”
verses.textLa: Homo quicumque fecerit simile, ut odore illius perfruatur, peribit de populis suis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah,
verses.textLa: Ecce, vocavi ex nomine Beseleel filium Uri filii Hur de tribu Iuda,

verses.textEn: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, and understanding, and knowledge in every craft,
verses.textLa: et implevi Spiritu Dei, sapientia, et intelligentia, et scientia in omni opere,

verses.textEn: in order to design whatever must be fabricated from gold, and silver, and brass,
verses.textLa: ad excogitandum quidquid fabrefieri potest ex auro, et argento, et ære,

verses.textEn: from marble, and precious stones, and various woods.
verses.textLa: marmore, et gemmis, et diversitate lignorum.

verses.textEn: And I have given to him, as his associate, Oholiab the son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan. And I have placed wisdom in the heart of every artisan, so that they may make everything as I have instructed you:
verses.textLa: Dedique ei socium Ooliab filium Achisamech de tribu Dan. Et in corde omnis eruditi posui sapientiam: ut faciant cuncta quæ præcepi tibi,

verses.textEn: the tabernacle of the covenant, and the ark of the testimony, and the propitiatory which is over it, and all the vessels of the tabernacle,
verses.textLa: tabernaculum fœderis, et arcam testimonii, et propitiatorium, quod super eam est, et cuncta vasa tabernaculi,

verses.textEn: and the table and its vessels, the most pure lampstand with its vessels, and the altars of incense
verses.textLa: mensamque et vasa eius, candelabrum purissimum cum vasis suis, et altaris thymiamatis,
verses.notes: The word ‘vasa’ in this context has more of the meaning of equipment or utensils; it is not limited specifically and only to actual containers.

verses.textEn: and of holocaust and all their vessels, the washtub with its base,
verses.textLa: et holocausti, et omnia vasa eorum, labrum cum basi sua,

verses.textEn: the holy vestments for the ministry of Aaron the priest, and for his sons, so that they may execute their office of sacred rites,
verses.textLa: vestes sanctas in ministerio Aaron sacerdoti, et filiis eius, ut fungantur officio suo in sacris,

verses.textEn: the oil of unction, and the incense of aromatics in the Sanctuary. All the things that I have instructed you, they shall make.”
verses.textLa: oleum unctionis, et thymiama aromatum in Sanctuario: omnia quæ præcepi tibi, facient.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Et locutus est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: See that you keep my Sabbath. For it is a sign between me and you among your generations, so that you may know that I am the Lord, who sanctifies you.
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Videte ut Sabbatum meum custodiatis: quia signum est inter me et vos in generationibus vestris: ut sciatis quia ego Dominus, qui sanctifico vos.

verses.textEn: Keep my Sabbath, for it is holy to you. Whoever will have polluted it, shall die a death. Whoever will have done any work in it, his soul shall perish from the midst of his people.
verses.textLa: Custodite sabbatum meum: sanctum est enim vobis: qui polluerit illud, morte morietur: qui fecerit in eo opus, peribit anima illius de medio populi sui.

verses.textEn: For six days you shall do work. On the seventh day, it is the Sabbath, a rest sanctified by the Lord. All who will have done work on this day shall die.
verses.textLa: Sex diebus facietis opus: in die septimo sabbatum est, requies sancta Domino. Omnis qui fecerit opus in hac die, morietur.

verses.textEn: Let the sons of Israel keep the Sabbath, and let them celebrate it throughout their generations. It is an everlasting covenant
verses.textLa: Custodiant filii Israel Sabbatum, et celebrent illud in generationibus suis. Pactum est sempiternum

verses.textEn: between me and the sons of Israel, and a perpetual sign. For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, and in the seventh he ceased from work.”
verses.textLa: inter me et filios Israel, signumque perpetuum. Sex enim diebus fecit Dominus cælum et terram, et in septimo ab opere cessavit.

verses.textEn: And the Lord, having completed speaking in this way on Mount Sinai, gave to Moses two stone tablets of testimony, written with the finger of God.
verses.textLa: Deditque Dominus Moysi, completis huiuscemodi sermonibus in monte Sinai, duas tabulas testimonii lapideas, scriptas digito Dei.

verses.textEn: Then the people, seeing that Moses made a delay in descending from the mountain, gathered together against Aaron, and said: “Rise up, make us gods, who may go before us. But as for this man Moses, who led us away from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has befallen him.”
verses.textLa: Videns autem populus quod moram faceret descendendi de monte Moyses, congregatus adversus Aaron, dixit: Surge, fac nobis deos, qui nos præcedant: Moysi enim huic viro, qui nos eduxit de Terra Ægypti, ignoramus quid acciderit.
verses.notes: Aaron did these things, even though he was a chosen priest of God for the Israelites. These acts by Aaron are a foreshadowing of the future betrayals by ordained persons who go astray from the Faith to worship falsely.

verses.textEn: And Aaron said to them, “Take the golden earrings from the ears of your wives, and your sons and daughters, and bring them to me.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque ad eos Aaron: Tollite inaures aureas de uxorum, filiorumque et filiarum vestrarum auribus, et afferte ad me.

verses.textEn: And the people did what he had commanded, carrying the earrings to Aaron.
verses.textLa: Fecitque populus quæ iusserat, deferens inaures ad Aaron.

verses.textEn: And when he had received them, he formed these by the work of a casting furnace, and he made from these a molten calf. And they said: “These are your gods, O Israel, who led you away from the land of Egypt.”
verses.textLa: Quas cum ille accepisset, formavit opere fusorio, et fecit ex eis vitulum conflatilem. Dixeruntque: Hi sunt dii tui Israel, qui te eduxerunt de Terra Ægypti.

verses.textEn: And when Aaron had seen it, he built an altar before it, and he cried out with a voice of proclamation, saying, “Tomorrow is the solemnity of the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Quod cum vidisset Aaron, ædificavit altare coram eo, et præconis voce clamavit, dicens: Cras sollemnitas Domini est.

verses.textEn: And rising up in the morning, they offered holocausts, and peace victims, and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and they rose up to play.
verses.textLa: Surgentesque mane, obtulerunt holocausta, et hostias pacificas, et sedit populus manducare, et bibere, et surrexerunt ludere.

verses.textEn: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying: “Go, descend. Your people, whom you led away from the land of Egypt, have sinned.
verses.textLa: Locutus est autem Dominus ad Moysen, dicens: Vade, descende: peccavit populus tuus, quem eduxisti de Terra Ægypti.

verses.textEn: They have quickly withdrawn from the way which you revealed to them. And they have made for themselves a molten calf, and they have worshiped it. And immolating victims to it, they have said: ‘These are your gods, O Israel, who led you away from the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.textLa: Recesserunt cito de via, quam ostendisti eis: feceruntque sibi vitulum conflatilem, et adoraverunt, atque immolantes ei hostias, dixerunt: Isti sunt dii tui Israel, qui te eduxerunt de Terra Ægypti.

verses.textEn: And again, the Lord said to Moses: “I discern that this people is stiff-necked.
verses.textLa: Rursumque ait Dominus ad Moysen: Cerno quod populus iste duræ cervicis sit:

verses.textEn: Release me, so that my fury may be enraged against them, and I may destroy them, and then I will make of you a great nation.”
verses.textLa: dimitte me, ut irascatur furor meus contra eos, et deleam eos, faciamque te in gentem magnam.

verses.textEn: Then Moses prayed to the Lord his God, saying: “Why, O Lord, is your fury enraged against your people, whom you led away from the land of Egypt, with great strength and with a mighty hand?
verses.textLa: Moyses autem orabat Dominum Deum suum, dicens: Cur, Domine, irascitur furor tuus contra populum tuum, quem eduxisti de Terra Ægypti, in fortitudine magna, et in manu robusta?

verses.textEn: I beg you, let not the Egyptians say, ‘He cleverly led them away, so that he could put them to death in the mountains and destroy them from the earth.’ Let your anger be quieted and appeased concerning the wickedness of your people.
verses.textLa: Ne quæso dicant Ægyptii: Callide eduxit eos, ut interficeret in montibus, et deleret e terra. Quiescat ira tua, et esto placabilis super nequitia populi tui.

verses.textEn: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your very self, saying: ‘I will multiply your offspring like the stars of heaven. And this entire land, about which I have spoken, I will give to your offspring. And you shall possess it forever.’ ”
verses.textLa: Recordare Abraham, Isaac, et Israel servorum tuorum, quibus iurasti per temetipsum, dicens: Multiplicabo semen vestrum sicut stellas cæli: et universam terram hanc, de qua locutus sum, dabo semini vestro, et possidebitis eam semper.

verses.textEn: And the Lord was appeased from doing the evil which he had spoken against his people.
verses.textLa: Placatusque est Dominus ne faceret malum quod locutus fuerat adversus populum suum.

verses.textEn: And Moses returned from the mountain, carrying the two tablets of the testimony in his hand, written on both sides,
verses.textLa: Et reversus est Moyses de monte, portans duas tabulas testimonii in manu sua, scriptas ex utraque parte,

verses.textEn: and accomplished by the work of God. Also, the writing of God was engraved on the tablets.
verses.textLa: et factas opere Dei: scriptura quoque Dei erat sculpta in tabulis.

verses.textEn: Then Joshua, hearing the tumult of the people shouting, said to Moses: “The outcry of battle is heard in the camp.”
verses.textLa: Audiens autem Iosue tumultum populi vociferantis, dixit ad Moysen: Ululatus pugnæ auditur in castris.

verses.textEn: But he responded: “It is not the clamor of men being exhorted to battle, nor the shout of men being compelled to flee. But I hear the voice of singing.”
verses.textLa: Qui respondit: Non est clamor adhortantium ad pugnam, neque vociferatio compellentium ad fugam: sed vocem cantantium ego audio.

verses.textEn: And when he had approached to the camp, he saw the calf and the dances. And being very angry, he threw down the tablets from his hand, and he broke them at the base of the mountain.
verses.textLa: Cumque appropinquasset ad castra, vidit vitulum, et choros: iratusque valde, proiecit de manu tabulas, et confregit eas ad radicem montis:

verses.textEn: And seizing the calf, which they had made, he burnt it and crushed it, even to dust, which he scattered into water. And he gave from it to the sons of Israel to drink.
verses.textLa: arripiensque vitulum quem fecerant, combussit, et contrivit usque ad pulverem, quem sparsit in aquam, et dedit ex eo potum filiis Israel.

verses.textEn: And he said to Aaron, “What has this people done to you, so that you would bring upon them the greatest sin?”
verses.textLa: Dixitque ad Aaron: Quid tibi fecit hic populus, ut induceres super eum peccatum maximum?
verses.notes: The worship of false gods is the greatest sin. It is the sin against the first commandment. It is directly and thoroughly opposed to the commandment to love God above all else. It is indirectly, and yet thoroughly, also opposed to the commandment to love your neighbor as yourself.

verses.textEn: And he answered him: “Let not my lord be indignant. For you know this people, that they are prone to evil.
verses.textLa: Cui ille respondit: Ne indignetur dominus meus: tu enim nosti populum istum, quod pronus sit ad malum:

verses.textEn: They said to me: ‘Make gods for us, who may go before us. For this Moses, who led us away from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has befallen him.’
verses.textLa: dixerunt mihi: Fac nobis deos, qui nos præcedant: huic enim Moysi, qui nos eduxit de Terra Ægypti, nescimus quid acciderit.

verses.textEn: And I said to them, ‘Which of you has gold?’ And they took it and gave it to me. And I threw it into the fire, and this calf came out.”
verses.textLa: Quibus ego dixi: Quis vestrum habet aurum? Tulerunt, et dederunt mihi: et proieci illud in ignem, egressusque est hic vitulus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses, seeing that the people were naked (for Aaron had stripped them because of the disgrace of their sordidness, and he had set them naked among their enemies),
verses.textLa: Videns ergo Moyses populum quod esset nudatus, (spoliaverat enim eum Aaron propter ignominiam sordis, et inter hostes nudum constituerat)

verses.textEn: and standing at the gate of the camp, said: “If anyone is for the Lord, let him join with me.” And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together to him.
verses.textLa: et stans in porta castrorum, ait: Si quis est Domini, iungatur mihi. Congregatique sunt ad eum omnes filii Levi:

verses.textEn: And he said to them: “Thus says the Lord God of Israel: Let a man place his sword at his thigh. Go forth, and then return, from gate to gate, through the midst of the camp, and let each one kill his brother, and friend, and neighbor.”
verses.textLa: quibus ait: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Ponat vir gladium super femur suum: ite, et redite de porta usque ad portam per medium castrorum, et occidat unusquisque fratrem, et amicum, et proximum suum.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Levi did according to the words of Moses, and there fell on that day about twenty-three thousand men.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque filii Levi iuxta sermonem Moysi, cecideruntque in die illa quasi viginti tria millia hominum.

verses.textEn: And Moses said: “On this day, you have consecrated your hands to the Lord, each one in his son and in his brother, so that a blessing may be given to you.”
verses.textLa: Et ait Moyses: Consecrastis manus vestras hodie Domino, unusquisque in filio, et in fratre suo, ut detur vobis benedictio.

verses.textEn: Then, when the next day arrived, Moses spoke to the people: “You have sinned the greatest sin. I will ascend to the Lord. Perhaps, in some way, I might be able to entreat him for your wickedness.”
verses.textLa: Facto autem altero die, locutus est Moyses ad populum: Peccastis peccatum maximum: ascendam ad Dominum, si quo modo quivero eum deprecari pro scelere vestro.

verses.textEn: And returning to the Lord, he said: “I beg you, this people has sinned the greatest sin, and they have made for themselves gods of gold. Either release them from this offense,
verses.textLa: Reversusque ad Dominum, ait: Obsecro, peccavit populus iste peccatum maximum, feceruntque sibi deos aureos: aut dimitte eis hanc noxam,

verses.textEn: or, if you do not, then delete me from the book that you have written.”
verses.textLa: aut si non facis, dele me de libro tuo quem scripsisti.

verses.textEn: And the Lord answered him: “Whoever has sinned against me, him I will delete from my book.
verses.textLa: Cui respondit Dominus: Qui peccaverit mihi, delebo eum de libro meo:

verses.textEn: But as for you, go and lead this people where I have told you. My angel will go before you. Then, on the day of retribution, I will also visit this sin of theirs.”
verses.textLa: Tu autem vade, et duc populum istum quo locutus sum tibi: Angelus meus præcedet te. Ego autem in die ultionis visitabo et hoc peccatum eorum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Lord struck the people for the guilt of the calf, which Aaron had made.
verses.textLa: Percussit ergo Dominus populum pro reatu vituli, quem fecerat Aaron.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying: “Go forth, ascend from this place, you and your people, whom you led away from the land of Egypt, into the land that I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying: To your offspring, I will give it.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens: Vade, ascende de loco isto tu, et populus tuus quem eduxisti de Terra Ægypti, in terram quam iuravi Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob, dicens: Semini tuo dabo eam:

verses.textEn: And I will send an Angel to precede you, so that I may cast out the Canaanite, and the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite,
verses.textLa: et mittam præcursorem tui Angelum, ut eiiciam Chananæum, et Amorrhæum, et Hethæum, et Pherezæum, et Hevæum, et Iebusæum,

verses.textEn: and so that you may enter into a land flowing with milk and honey. For I will not go up with you, since you are a stiff-necked people, lest perhaps I may destroy you on the way.”
verses.textLa: et intres in terram fluentem lacte et melle. Non enim ascendam tecum, quia populus duræ cervicis es: ne forte disperdam te in via.

verses.textEn: And upon hearing this very bad news, the people mourned; and no one put on his finery according to custom.
verses.textLa: Audiensque populus sermonem hunc pessimum, luxit: et nullus ex more indutus est cultu suo.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses: “Say to the sons of Israel: You are a stiff-necked people. I should at once go up into your midst and destroy you. Now immediately put aside your ornaments, so that I may know what to do to you.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Loquere filiis Israel: Populus duræ cervicis es, semel ascendam in medio tui, et delebo te. Iam nunc depone ornatum tuum, ut sciam quid faciam tibi.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the sons of Israel put aside their ornaments before Mount Horeb.
verses.textLa: Deposuerunt ergo filii Israel ornatum suum a monte Horeb.

verses.textEn: Also, Moses took the tabernacle and pitched it beyond the camp at a distance, and he called its name: ‘Tabernacle of the Covenant.’ And all the people, who had any kind of question, went out to the Tabernacle of the Covenant, beyond the camp.
verses.textLa: Moyses quoque tollens tabernaculum, tetendit extra castra procul, vocavitque nomen eius, Tabernaculum fœderis. Et omnis populus, qui habebat aliquam quæstionem, egrediebatur ad Tabernaculum fœderis, extra castra.

verses.textEn: And when Moses went out to the tabernacle, all the people rose up, and each one stood at the door of his pavilion, and they beheld the back of Moses until he entered the tent.
verses.textLa: Cumque egrederetur Moyses ad tabernaculum, surgebat universa plebs, et stabat unusquisque in ostio papilionis sui, aspiciebantque tergum Moysi, donec ingrederetur tentorium.

verses.textEn: And when he had gone into the Tabernacle of the Covenant, the pillar of cloud descended and stood at the door, and he spoke with Moses.
verses.textLa: Ingresso autem illo Tabernaculum fœderis, descendebat columna nubis, et stabat ad ostium, loquebaturque cum Moyse,

verses.textEn: And all discerned that the pillar of cloud stood at the door of the Tabernacle. And they stood and worshipped at the doors of their tents.
verses.textLa: cernentibus universis quod columna nubis staret ad ostium Tabernaculi. Stabantque ipsi, et adorabant per fores tabernaculorum suorum.

verses.textEn: But the Lord spoke to Moses face to face, just as a man is used to speaking to his friend. And when he returned to the camp, his minister Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, did not withdraw from the Tabernacle.
verses.textLa: Loquebatur autem Dominus ad Moysen facie ad faciem, sicut solet loqui homo ad amicum suum. Cumque ille reverteretur in castra, minister eius Iosue filius Nun, puer, non recedebat de Tabernaculo.

verses.textEn: Then Moses said to the Lord: “You instruct me to lead this people away, and you do not reveal to me whom you will send with me, particularly since you have said: ‘I know you by name, and you have found favor before me.’
verses.textLa: Dixit autem Moyses ad Dominum: Præcipis ut educam populum istum: et non indicas mihi quem missurus es mecum, præsertim cum dixeris: Novi te ex nomine, et invenisti gratiam coram me.

verses.textEn: If, therefore, I have found favor in your sight, show your face to me, so that I may know you and may find grace before your eyes. Look favorably on your people, this nation.”
verses.textLa: Si ergo inveni gratiam in conspectu tuo, ostende mihi faciem tuam, ut sciam te, et inveniam gratiam ante oculos tuos: respice populum tuum gentem hanc.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said, “My face will precede you, and I will give you rest.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus: Facies mea præcedet te, et requiem dabo tibi.

verses.textEn: And Moses said: “If you will not yourself precede us, then do not lead us away from this place.
verses.textLa: Et ait Moyses: Si non tu ipse præcedas, ne educas nos de loco isto.

verses.textEn: For how will we be able to know, I and your people, that we have found grace in your sight, unless you walk with us, so that we may be glorified out of all the people who live upon the earth?”
verses.textLa: In quo enim scire poterimus ego et populus tuus invenisse nos gratiam in conspectu tuo, nisi ambulaveris nobiscum, ut glorificemur ab omnibus populis qui habitant super terram?

verses.textEn: Then the Lord said to Moses: “This word also, which you have spoken, I will do. For you have found grace before me, and I have known you by name.”
verses.textLa: Dixit autem Dominus ad Moysen: Et verbum istud, quod locutus es, faciam: invenisti enim gratiam coram me, et teipsum novi ex nomine.

verses.textEn: And he said, “Show me your glory.”
verses.textLa: Qui ait: Ostende mihi gloriam tuam.

verses.textEn: He responded: “I will show you all that is good, and I will call out with the name of the Lord before you. And I will take pity on whomever I will, and I will be lenient to whomever it will please me.”
verses.textLa: Respondit: Ego ostendam omne bonum tibi, et vocabo in nomine Domini coram te: et miserebor cui voluero, et clemens ero in quem mihi placuerit.

verses.textEn: And again he said: “You are not able to see my face. For man shall not see me and live.”
verses.textLa: Rursumque ait: Non poteris videre faciem meam: non enim videbit me homo, et vivet.

verses.textEn: And again, he said: “Behold, there is a place with me, and you shall stand upon the rock.
verses.textLa: Et iterum: Ecce, inquit, est locus apud me, et stabis supra petram.

verses.textEn: And when my glory will cross over, I will set you in a cleft of the rock, and I will protect you with my right hand, until I pass by.
verses.textLa: Cumque transibit gloria mea, ponam te in foramine petræ, et protegam dextera mea, donec transeam:

verses.textEn: And I will take away my hand, and you shall see my back. But my face you are not able to see.”
verses.textLa: tollamque manum meam, et videbis posteriora mea: faciem autem meam videre non poteris.

verses.textEn: And after this he said: “Cut out for yourself two tablets of stone similar to the first ones, and I will write upon them the words which were held on the tablets that you broke.
verses.textLa: Ac deinceps: Præcide, ait, tibi duas tabulas lapideas instar priorum, et scribam super eas verba, quæ habuerunt tabulæ, quas fregisti.

verses.textEn: Be prepared in the morning, so that you may immediately ascend onto Mount Sinai, and you shall stand with me on the summit of the mountain.
verses.textLa: Esto paratus mane, ut ascendas statim in montem Sinai, stabisque mecum super verticem montis.

verses.textEn: Let no one ascend with you, and do not let anyone be seen throughout the entire mountain. Likewise, do not let the oxen or the sheep pasture up against it.”
verses.textLa: Nullus ascendat tecum, nec videatur quispiam per totum montem: boves quoque et oves non pascantur e contra.

verses.textEn: And so he cut out two tablets of stone, like those that were before. And rising up in the night, he ascended onto Mount Sinai, just as the Lord had instructed him, carrying with him the tablets.
verses.textLa: Excidit ergo duas tabulas lapideas, quales antea fuerant: et de nocte consurgens ascendit in montem Sinai, sicut præceperat ei Dominus, portans secum tabulas.

verses.textEn: And when the Lord had descended in a cloud, Moses stood with him, calling upon the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Cumque descendisset Dominus per nubem, stetit Moyses cum eo, invocans nomen Domini.

verses.textEn: And as he was crossing before him, he said: “The Ruler, the Lord God, merciful and lenient, patient and full of compassion and also truthful,
verses.textLa: Quo transeunte coram eo, ait: Dominator Domine Deus, misericors et clemens, patiens et multæ miserationis, ac verax,

verses.textEn: who preserves mercy a thousand fold, who takes away iniquity, and wickedness, and also sin; and with you no one, in and of himself, is innocent. You render the iniquity of the fathers to the sons, and also to their descendants to the third and fourth generation.”
verses.textLa: qui custodis misericordiam in millia: qui aufers iniquitatem, et scelera, atque peccata, nullusque apud te per se innocens est. Qui reddis iniquitatem patrum filiis, ac nepotibus in tertiam et quartam progeniem.

verses.textEn: And hurrying, Moses bowed down prostrate to the ground; and worshiping,
verses.textLa: Festinusque Moyses, curvatus est pronus in terram, et adorans

verses.textEn: he said: “If I have found grace in your sight, O Lord, I beg you to walk with us, (for the people are stiff-necked) and take away our iniquities and our sin, and so possess us.”
verses.textLa: ait: Si inveni gratiam in conspectu tuo Domine, obsecro ut gradiaris nobiscum (populus enim duræ cervicis est) et auferas iniquitates nostras atque peccata, nosque possideas.

verses.textEn: The Lord responded: “I will enter into a pact in the sight of all. I will perform signs which have never been seen on earth, nor among any nation, so that this people, in whose midst you are, may discern the terrible work of the Lord that I will do.
verses.textLa: Respondit Dominus: Ego inibo pactum videntibus cunctis, signa faciam quæ numquam visa sunt super terram, nec in ullis gentibus: ut cernat populus iste, in cuius es medio, opus Domini terribile quod facturus sum.

verses.textEn: Observe everything that I command you this day. I myself will drive out before your face the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.textLa: Observa cuncta quæ hodie mando tibi: ego ipse eiiciam ante faciem tuam Amorrhæum, et Chananæum, et Hethæum, Pherezæum quoque, et Hevæum, et Iebusæum.

verses.textEn: Beware that you do not ever join in friendship with the inhabitants of that land, which may be your ruin.
verses.textLa: Cave ne umquam cum habitatoribus terræ illius iungas amicitias, quæ sint tibi in ruinam:

verses.textEn: But destroy their altars, break their statues, and cut down their sacred groves.
verses.textLa: sed aras eorum destrue, confringe statuas, lucosque succide:

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to worship any strange god. The jealous Lord is his name. God is a rival.
verses.textLa: noli adorare deum alienum. Dominus zelotes nomen eius, Deus est æmulator.

verses.textEn: Do not enter into a pact with the men of those regions, lest, when they will have fornicated with their gods and worshiped their idols, someone might call upon you to eat from what was immolated.
verses.textLa: Ne ineas pactum cum hominibus illarum regionum: ne, cum fornicati fuerint cum diis suis, et adoraverint simulcra eorum, vocet te quispiam ut comedas de immolatis.

verses.textEn: Neither shall you take a wife for your son from their daughters, lest, after they themselves have fornicated, they may cause your sons also to fornicate with their gods.
verses.textLa: Nec uxorem de filiabus eorum accipies filiis tuis: ne, postquam ipsæ fuerint fornicatæ, fornicari faciant et filios tuos in deos suos.

verses.textEn: You shall not make for yourselves any molten gods.
verses.textLa: Deos conflatiles non facies tibi.

verses.textEn: You shall keep the solemnity of unleavened bread. For seven days, you shall eat unleavened bread, just as I instructed you, in the time of the month of what is new. For in the month of springtime you departed from Egypt.
verses.textLa: Sollemnitatem azymorum custodies. Septem diebus vesceris azymis, sicut præcepi tibi, in tempore mensis novorum: mense enim verni temporis egressus es de Ægypto.
verses.notes: The phrase ‘mensis novorum’ uses the adjective ‘novorum’ as a noun: ‘the month of newness,’ or ‘the month of what is new,’ which indicates the springtime, i.e. the time of the grain harvest.

verses.textEn: All of the male kind, which open the womb, shall be mine: from all the animals, as much of oxen as of sheep, it shall be mine.
verses.textLa: Omne, quod aperit vulvam generis maculini, meum erit. De cunctis animantibus tam de bobus, quam de ovibus, meum erit.

verses.textEn: The firstborn of a donkey, you shall redeem with a sheep. But if you will not give a price for it, it shall be slain. The firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. You shall not appear empty in my sight.
verses.textLa: Primogenitum asini redimes ove: sin autem nec pretium pro eo dederis, occidetur. Primogenitum filiorum tuorum redimes: nec apparebis in conspectu meo vacuus.

verses.textEn: For six days you shall work. On the seventh day you shall cease to cultivate and to harvest.
verses.textLa: Sex diebus operaberis, die septimo cessabis arare, et metere.

verses.textEn: You shall observe the Solemnity of Weeks with the first-fruits of the grain from the harvest of your wheat, and a Solemnity when the time of the year returns and everything is stored away.
verses.textLa: Sollemnitatem hebdomadarum facies tibi in primitiis frugum messis tuæ triticeæ, et sollemnitatem, quando redeunte anni tempore cuncta conduntur.
verses.notes: More literally, this is the solemnity of sevens (or of groups of sevens). It is a count of seven sets of seven days, from Passover to Pentecost (the Jewish Pentecost or Feast of Weeks).

verses.textEn: Three times a year, all your males shall appear in the sight of the Almighty, the Lord God of Israel.
verses.textLa: Tribus temporibus anni apparebit omne masculinum tuum in conspectu Omnipotentis, Domini Dei Israel.
verses.notes: The three feasts are Passover, Pentecost, and the Feast of Tabernacles, so the feast or solemnity at the end of the year would be the Feast of Tabernacles, which occurs at the end of the civil calendar year and at the end of the year counted from the start of planting grain in the fall.

verses.textEn: For when I will have taken away the nations before your face, and enlarged your borders, no one shall lie in wait against your land when you will go up to appear in the sight of the Lord your God, three times a year.
verses.textLa: Cum enim tulero gentes a facie tua, et dilatavero terminos tuos, nullus insidiabitur terræ tuæ, ascendente te, et apparente in conspectu Domini Dei tui ter in anno.

verses.textEn: You shall not immolate the blood of my victim over leaven; and there shall not remain, in the morning, any of the victim of the Solemnity of the Passover.
verses.textLa: Non immolabis super fermento sanguinem hostiæ meæ: neque residebit mane de victima sollemnitatis Phase.

verses.textEn: The first of the fruits of your land you shall offer in the house of the Lord your God. You shall not boil a young goat in the milk of its mother.”
verses.textLa: Primitias frugum terræ tuæ offeres in domo Domini Dei tui. Non coques hœdum in lacte matris suæ.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses, “Write these words to you, through which I have formed a covenant, both with you and with Israel.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Scribe tibi verba hæc, quibus et tecum et cum Israel pepigi fœdus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, he was in that place with the Lord for forty days and forty nights; he did not eat bread and he did not drink water, and he wrote on the tablets the ten words of the covenant.
verses.textLa: Fuit ergo ibi cum Domino quadraginta dies et quadraginta noctes: panem non comedit, et aquam non bibit, et scripsit in tabulis verba fœderis decem.

verses.textEn: And when Moses descended from Mount Sinai, he held the two tablets of the testimony, and he did not know that his face was radiant from the sharing of words with the Lord.
verses.textLa: Cumque descenderet Moyses de monte Sinai, tenebat duas tabulas testimonii, et ignorabat quod cornuta esset facies sua ex consortio sermonis Domini.
verses.notes:
The Latin text clearly refers to horns on Moses. Some say that this is an ancient misunderstanding (which they attribute to Saint Jerome) of the Hebrew word ‘qaran’ which can refer to horns or to rays of light. In any case, Moses was a figure and a foreshadowing of Christ, the Lamb of God, so it is fitting that Moses be depicted with horns.
 In this translation, however, the Hebrew text will be used to correct the Latin. The Neo-Vulgate and the Jerusalem Bible Readers Edition and online sources were consulted on this point.

verses.textEn: Then Aaron and the sons of Israel, seeing that the face of Moses was radiant, were afraid to approach close by.
verses.textLa: Videntes autem Aaron et filii Israel cornutam Moysi faciem, timuerunt prope accedere.

verses.textEn: And being called by him, they turned back, both Aaron and the leaders of the assembly. And after he had spoken to them,
verses.textLa: Vocatique ab eo, reversi sunt tam Aaron, quam principes synagogæ. Et postquam locutus est ad eos,

verses.textEn: all the sons of Israel also now came to him. And he instructed them in all the things that he had heard from the Lord on Mount Sinai.
verses.textLa: venerunt ad eum etiam omnes filii Israel: quibus præcepit cuncta quæ audierat a Domino in monte Sinai.

verses.textEn: And having completed these words, he placed a veil over his face.
verses.textLa: Impletisque sermonibus, posuit velamen super faciem suam.

verses.textEn: But when he entered to the Lord and was speaking with him, he took it off, until he exited. And then he spoke to the sons of Israel all that had been commanded to him.
verses.textLa: Quod ingressus ad Dominum, et loquens cum eo, auferebat donec exiret, et tunc loquebatur ad filios Israel omnia quæ sibi fuerant imperata.

verses.textEn: And they saw that the face of Moses, when he came out, was radiant, but he covered his face again, whenever he spoke to them.
verses.textLa: Qui videbant faciem egredientis Moysi esse cornutam, sed operiebat ille rursus faciem suam, si quando loquebatur ad eos.

verses.textEn: Therefore, when all the multitude of the sons of Israel had gathered together, he said to them: “These are the things that the Lord has ordered to be done:
verses.textLa: Igitur congregata omni turba filiorum Israel, dixit ad eos: Hæc sunt quæ iussit Dominus fieri.

verses.textEn: For six days you shall do work; the seventh day, the Sabbath and the rest of the Lord, will be holy to you; whoever will have done any work in it shall be killed.
verses.textLa: Sex diebus facietis opus: septimus dies erit vobis sanctus, Sabbatum, et requies Domini: qui fecerit opus in eo, occidetur.

verses.textEn: You shall not kindle a fire in any of your dwelling places throughout the day of the Sabbath.”
verses.textLa: Non succendetis ignem in omnibus habitaculis vestris per diem Sabbati.

verses.textEn: And Moses said to the entire crowd of the sons of Israel: “This is the word which the Lord has instructed, saying:
verses.textLa: Et ait Moyses ad omnem catervam filiorum Israel: Iste est sermo quem præcepit Dominus, dicens:

verses.textEn: Separate from among you the first-fruits to the Lord. Let all who are willing and have a ready soul offer these to the Lord: gold, and silver, and brass,
verses.textLa: Separate apud vos primitias Domino. Omnis voluntarius et prono animo offerat eas Domino: aurum et argentum, et æs,

verses.textEn: hyacinth, and purple, and twice-dyed scarlet, and fine linen, the hair of goats,
verses.textLa: hyacinthum et purpuram, coccumque bis tinctum, et byssum, pilos caprarum,

verses.textEn: and the skins of rams, dyed red, and violet skins, setim wood,
verses.textLa: pellesque arietum rubricatas, et ianthinas, ligna setim,

verses.textEn: and oil to prepare lights and to produce ointment, and most sweet incense,
verses.textLa: et oleum ad luminaria concinnanda, et ut conficiatur unguentum, et thymiama suavissimum,

verses.textEn: onyx stones and gems, to adorn the ephod and the breastplate.
verses.textLa: lapides onychinos, et gemmas ad ornatum superhumeralis et rationalis.

verses.textEn: And whoever among you is wise, let him come and make what the Lord has commanded:
verses.textLa: Quisque vestrum sapiens est, veniat, et faciat quod Dominus imperavit:

verses.textEn: the tabernacle, certainly, and its roof, and also the covering, the rings, and the panels with the bars, the tent pegs and the bases,
verses.textLa: Tabernaculum scilicet, et tectum eius, atque operimentum, annulos, et tabulata cum vectibus, paxillos et bases:

verses.textEn: the ark and its bars, the propitiatory, and the veil that is drawn before it,
verses.textLa: Arcam et vectes, propitiatorium, et velum, quod ante illud oppanditur:

verses.textEn: the table with its bars and vessels, and the bread of the presence,
verses.textLa: Mensam cum vectibus et vasis, et propositionis panibus:

verses.textEn: the lampstand to hold up the lights, its vessels and lamps, and the oil to the nourish the fire,
verses.textLa: Candelabrum ad luminaria sustentanda, vasa illius et lucernas, et oleum ad nutrimenta ignium:

verses.textEn: the altar of incense and its bars, and the oil of unction, and the incense of aromatics, the tent at the door of the tabernacle,
verses.textLa: Altare thymiamatis, et vectes, et oleum unctionis et thymiama ex aromatibus: Tentorium ad ostium tabernaculi:

verses.textEn: the altar of holocaust and its grate of brass, with the bars and vessels, the washtub and its base,
verses.textLa: Altare holocausti, et craticulam eius æneam cum vectibus et vasis suis: labrum et basim eius:

verses.textEn: the curtains of the atrium, with the columns and the bases, the hanging at the doors of the vestibule,
verses.textLa: Cortinas atrii cum columnis et basibus, tentorium in foribus vestibuli,

verses.textEn: the tent pegs of the tabernacle and the atrium, with their little cords,
verses.textLa: paxillos tabernaculi et atrii cum funiculis suis:

verses.textEn: the vestments, which are to be used in the ministry of the Sanctuary, the vestments of Aaron, the high priest, as well as those of his sons, in order to exercise the priesthood to me.”
verses.textLa: Vestimenta, quorum usus est in ministerio Sanctuarii, vestes Aaron pontificis ac filiorum eius, ut sacerdotio fungantur mihi.

verses.textEn: And all the multitude of the sons of Israel, departing from the sight of Moses,
verses.textLa: Egressaque omnis multitudo filiorum Israel de conspectu Moysi,

verses.textEn: offered the first-fruits to the Lord with a most ready and devout mind, to accomplish the work of the tabernacle of the testimony. Whatever was needed for worship and for the holy vestments,
verses.textLa: obtulerunt mente promptissima atque devota primitias Domino, ad faciendum opus tabernaculi testimonii. Quidquid ad cultum et ad vestes sanctas necessarium erat,

verses.textEn: men along with women provided: arm bands and earrings, rings and bracelets. And every vessel of gold was separated, to be donated to the Lord.
verses.textLa: viri cum mulieribus præbuerunt, armillas et inaures, annulos et dextralia: omne vas aureum in donaria Domini separatum est.

verses.textEn: If anyone had hyacinth, and purple, and twice-dyed scarlet, fine linen and the hair of goats, the skins of rams, dyed red, and violet skins,
verses.textLa: Si quis habebat hyacinthum, et purpuram, coccumque bis tinctum, byssum et pilos caprarum, pelles arietum rubricatas, et ianthinas,

verses.textEn: metal of silver and brass, they offered it to the Lord, along with setim wood for various uses.
verses.textLa: argenti, ærisque metalla obtulerunt Domino, lignaque setim in varios usus.

verses.textEn: But the skillful women also gave whatever they had spun: hyacinth, purple, and vermillion, as well as fine linen,
verses.textLa: Sed et mulieres doctæ, quæ neverant, dederunt hyacinthum, purpuram, et vermiculum, ac byssum,
verses.notes: The word ‘vermillion’ is derived from the Latin vermiculus, originally referring to dyes made from some type of grub or larvae. However, in ancient Egypt the color may have been made by grinding minerals containing mercury sulfide (also called cinnabar). So the hyacinth was made from flowers (as Flavius Josephus attests), the purple was made from mollusks in the sea, the scarlet (in Latin: coccum, referring to cochineal carmine) described in other verses was made from insects, and the vermillion may well have been made from minerals (cinnabar). The violet skins are not referred to as ‘dyed’ but seem to have been that color naturally. So then, the Tabernacle had colors from all of nature: from sea and land, from plants, insects, animals, and minerals.

verses.textEn: and the hair of goats, donating everything of their own accord.
verses.textLa: et pilos caprarum, sponte propria cuncta tribuentes.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the leaders offered onyx stones and gems, for the ephod and the breastplate,
verses.textLa: Principes vero obtulerunt lapides onychinos, et gemmas ad superhumerale et rationale,

verses.textEn: and aromatics and oil, to maintain the lights, and to prepare ointment, and also to produce incense with a most sweet odor.
verses.textLa: aromataque et oleum ad luminaria concinnanda, et ad præparandum unguentum, ac thymiama odoris suavissimi componendum.

verses.textEn: All the men and women offered donations with a devout mind, so that the works might be done which the Lord had ordered by the hand of Moses. All the sons of Israel dedicated voluntary offerings to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Omnes viri et mulieres mente devota obtulerunt donaria, ut fierent opera quæ iusserat Dominus per manum Moysi. Cuncti filii Israel voluntaria Domino dedicaverunt.

verses.textEn: And Moses said to the sons of Israel: “Behold, the Lord has called by name Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah,
verses.textLa: Dixitque Moyses ad filios Israel: Ecce, vocavit Dominus ex nomine Beseleel filium Uri filii Hur de tribu Iuda.

verses.textEn: and he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, and understanding, and knowledge, and all teaching,
verses.textLa: Implevitque eum Spiritu Dei, sapientia et intelligentia, et scientia et omni doctrina

verses.textEn: to design and to fashion, with gold and silver and brass,
verses.textLa: ad excogitandum, et faciendum opus in auro et argento, et ære,

verses.textEn: and with engraving stones, and with the skill of a carpenter. Whatever can be skillfully invented,
verses.textLa: sculpendisque lapidibus, et opere carpentario. Quidquid fabre adinveniri potest,

verses.textEn: he has given to his heart. It is likewise with Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach from the tribe of Dan.
verses.textLa: dedit in corde eius: Ooliab quoque filium Achisamech de tribu Dan:

verses.textEn: He has taught both of them wisdom, in order to do the work of carpentry, tapestry, and embroidery, from hyacinth, and purple, and twice-dyed scarlet, and fine linen, and every textile, and to discover whatever may be new.”
verses.textLa: ambos erudivit sapientia, ut faciant opera abietarii, polymitarii, ac plumarii de hyacintho ac purpura, coccoque bis tincto, et bysso, et texant omnia, ac nova quæque reperiant.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Bezalel, and Oholiab, and every wise man, to whom the Lord gave wisdom and intelligence, so as to know how to work skillfully, made that which was necessary for the uses of the Sanctuary and which the Lord had instructed.
verses.textLa: Fecit ergo Beseleel, et Ooliab, et omnis vir sapiens, quibus dedit Dominus sapientiam et intellectum, ut scirent fabre operari quæ in usus Sanctuarii necessaria sunt, et quæ præcepit Dominus.

verses.textEn: And when Moses had called them and every man of learning, to whom the Lord had given wisdom, and who, of their own accord, had offered themselves in order to accomplish this work,
verses.textLa: Cumque vocasset eos Moyses, et omnem eruditum virum, cui dederat Dominus sapientiam, et qui sponte sua obtulerant se ad faciendum opus,

verses.textEn: he handed over to them all the donations of the sons of Israel. And while they were pursuing this work, the people offered what they had vowed each day, in the morning.
verses.textLa: tradidit eis universa donaria filiorum Israel. Qui cum instarent operi, quotidie mane vota populus offerebat.

verses.textEn: The artisans were compelled by this to go
verses.textLa: Unde artifices venire compulsi,

verses.textEn: to Moses and to say, “The people offer more than is needed.”
verses.textLa: dixerunt Moysi: Plus offert populus quam necessarium est.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses ordered this to be recited, with a voice of proclamation: “Let neither man nor woman offer anything further for the work of the Sanctuary.” And so they ceased from offering gifts,
verses.textLa: Iussit ergo Moyses præconis voce cantari: Nec vir nec mulier quidquam offerat ultra in opere Sanctuarii. Sicque cessatum est a muneribus offerendis,

verses.textEn: because what was offered was sufficient and was more than an abundance.
verses.textLa: eo quod oblata sufficerent et superabundarent.

verses.textEn: And all those who were wise of heart, in order to accomplish the work of the tabernacle, made ten curtains of fine twisted linen, and hyacinth, and purple, and twice-dyed scarlet, with diverse workmanship by the art of embroidery.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque omnes corde sapientes ad explendum opus tabernaculi, cortinas decem de bysso retorta, et hyacintho, et purpura, coccoque bis tincto, opere vario, et arte polymita:

verses.textEn: Each of these was twenty-eight cubits in length, and in width, four. All the curtains were of one measure.
verses.textLa: quarum una habebat in longitudine vigintiocto cubitos, et in latitudine quattuor. Una mensura erat omnium cortinarum.

verses.textEn: And he joined five curtains to one another, and the other five he coupled to one another.
verses.textLa: Coniunxitque cortinas quinque, alteram alteri, et alias quinque sibi invicem copulavit.

verses.textEn: He also made loops of hyacinth along the edge of one curtain on both sides, and similarly along the edge of the other curtain,
verses.textLa: Fecit et ansas hyacinthinas in ora cortinæ unius ex utroque latere, et in ora cortinæ alterius similiter,

verses.textEn: so that the loops might meet against one another and might be joined together.
verses.textLa: ut contra se invicem venirent ansæ, et mutuo iungerentur.

verses.textEn: For these, he also cast fifty gold rings, which would retain the loops of the curtains and so make the tabernacle one.
verses.textLa: Unde et quinquaginta fudit circulos aureos, qui morderent cortinarum ansas, et fieret unum tabernaculum.

verses.textEn: He also made eleven canopies from the hair of goats, in order to cover the roof of the tabernacle:
verses.textLa: Fecit et saga undecim de pilis caprarum ad operiendum tectum tabernaculi:

verses.textEn: one canopy held in length thirty cubits, and in width four cubits. All the canopies were of one measure.
verses.textLa: unum sagum in longitudine habebat cubitos triginta, et in latitudine cubitos quattuor: unius mensuræ erant omnia saga:

verses.textEn: Five of these he joined by themselves, and the other six separately.
verses.textLa: quorum quinque iunxit seorsum, et sex alia separatim.

verses.textEn: And he made fifty loops along the edge of one canopy, and fifty along the edge of the other canopy, so that they might be joined to one another,
verses.textLa: Fecitque ansas quinquaginta in ora sagi unius, et quinquaginta in ora sagi alterius, ut sibi invicem iungerentur.

verses.textEn: and fifty buckles of brass, with which the roof might be woven together, so that from all the canopies there would be made one covering.
verses.textLa: Et fibulas æneas quinquaginta, quibus necteretur tectum, ut unum pallium ex omnibus sagis fieret.

verses.textEn: He also made a covering for the tabernacle from the skins of rams, dyed-red; and another cover above it, from violet skins.
verses.textLa: Fecit et opertorium tabernaculi de pellibus arietum rubricatis: aliudque desuper velamentum de pellibus ianthinis.

verses.textEn: He also made the standing panels of the tabernacle, from setim wood.
verses.textLa: Fecit et tabulas tabernaculi de lignis setim stantes.

verses.textEn: Ten cubits was the length of one panel, and one and one half cubits comprised the width.
verses.textLa: Decem cubitorum erat longitudo tabulæ unius: et unum ac semis cubitum latitudo retinebat.

verses.textEn: There were two dovetails along every panel, so that one might be joined to the other. Thus did he make all the panels of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: Binæ incastraturæ erant per singulas tabulas, ut altera alteri iungeretur. Sic fecit in omnibus tabernaculi tabulis.

verses.textEn: Of these, twenty were toward the meridian area, opposite the south,
verses.textLa: E quibus viginti ad plagam meridianam erant contra Austrum,

verses.textEn: with forty bases of silver. Two bases were set under one panel at each of two sides at the corners, where the joints of the sides terminate in corners.
verses.textLa: cum quadraginta basibus argenteis. Duæ bases sub una tabula ponebantur ex utraque parte angulorum, ubi incastraturæ laterum in angulis terminantur.

verses.textEn: Likewise, at that side of the tabernacle which looks toward the north, he made twenty panels,
verses.textLa: Ad plagam quoque tabernaculi, quæ respicit ad Aquilonem, fecit viginti tabulas,

verses.textEn: with forty bases of silver, two bases for each board.
verses.textLa: cum quadraginta basibus argenteis, duas bases per singulas tabulas.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, opposite the west, that is, toward that part of the tabernacle which looks out toward the sea, he made six panels,
verses.textLa: Contra Occidentem vero, id est, ad eam partem tabernaculi, quæ mare respicit, fecit sex tabulas,

verses.textEn: and two others at each corner of the tabernacle at the back,
verses.textLa: et duas alias per singulos angulos tabernaculi retro:
verses.notes: The word ‘retro’ refers to the back of the Tabernacle, which was toward the west. This end had two more panels than the east. Therefore, the entrance was at the east and was two panels (three royal cubits or just over 5 feet) in width, which is wide enough for two men to enter side by side.

verses.textEn: which were joined from bottom to top and held together by one joint. So did he make both corners on that side.
verses.textLa: quæ iunctæ erant a deorsum usque sursum, et in unam compaginem pariter ferebantur. Ita fecit ex utraque parte per angulos:

verses.textEn: So then, there were altogether eight panels, and they had sixteen bases of silver, with, of course, two bases under each panel.
verses.textLa: ut octo essent simul tabulæ, et haberent bases argenteas sedecim, binas scilicet bases sub singulis tabulis.

verses.textEn: He also made bars from setim wood: five to hold together the panels at one side of the tabernacle,
verses.textLa: Fecit et vectes de lignis setim, quinque ad continendas tabulas unius lateris tabernaculi,

verses.textEn: and five others to fit together the panels of the other side, and, in addition to these, five other bars toward the western area of the tabernacle, opposite the sea.
verses.textLa: et quinque alios ad alterius lateris coaptandas tabulas: et extra hos, quinque alios vectes ad occidentalem plagam tabernaculi contra mare.

verses.textEn: He also made another bar, which came through the middle of the panels from corner to corner.
verses.textLa: Fecit quoque vectem alium, qui per medias tabulas ab angulo usque ad angulum perveniret.

verses.textEn: But the panels themselves he overlaid with gold, casting silver bases for them. And he made their rings from gold, through which the bars might be able to be drawn. And he covered the bars themselves with layers of gold.
verses.textLa: Ipsa autem tabulata deauravit, fusis basibus earum argenteis. Et circulos eorum fecit aureos, per quos vectes induci possent: quos et ipsos laminis aureis operuit.

verses.textEn: He also made a veil from hyacinth, and purple, from vermillion as well as fine twisted linen, with varied and distinctive embroidery,
verses.textLa: Fecit et velum de hyacintho, et purpura, vermiculo, ac bysso retorta, opere polymitario, varium atque distinctum:

verses.textEn: and four columns of setim wood, which, along with their heads, he overlaid with gold, casting silver bases for them.
verses.textLa: et quattuor columnas de lignis setim, quas cum capitibus deauravit, fusis basibus earum argenteis.

verses.textEn: He also made a tent at the entrance of the tabernacle from hyacinth, purple, vermillion, and fine twisted linen, wrought with embroidery,
verses.textLa: Fecit et tentorium in introitu tabernaculi ex hyacintho, purpura, vermiculo, byssoque retorta, opere plumarii:

verses.textEn: and five columns with their heads, which he covered with gold, and he cast their bases from brass.
verses.textLa: et columnas quinque cum capitibus suis, quas operuit auro, basesque earum fudit æneas.

verses.textEn: Now Bezalel also made the ark from setim wood, having two and one half cubits in length, and one and one half cubits in width, and the height was also one and one half cubits. And he clothed it with the purest gold, inside and out.
verses.textLa: Fecit autem Beseleel et arcam de lignis setim, habentem duos semis cubitos in longitudine, et cubitum ac semissem in latitudine, altitudo quoque unius cubiti fuit et dimidii: vestivitque eam auro purissimo intus ac foris.

verses.textEn: And for it he made a crown of gold all around,
