verses.textLa: Et fecit illi coronam auream per gyrum,

verses.textEn: casting four gold rings at its four corners: two rings on one side, and two on the other.
verses.textLa: conflans quattuor annulos aureos per quattuor angulos eius: duos annulos in latere uno, et duos in altero.

verses.textEn: Likewise, he made bars from setim wood, which he clothed with gold,
verses.textLa: Vectes quoque fecit de lignis setim, quos vestivit auro,

verses.textEn: and he placed them into the rings, which were at the sides of the ark, to carry it.
verses.textLa: et quos misit in annulos, qui erant in lateribus arcæ ad portandum eam.

verses.textEn: He also made the propitiatory, that is, the oracle, from the finest gold, two and one half cubits in length, and one and one half cubits in width,
verses.textLa: Fecit et propitiatorium, id est, oraculum, de auro mundissimo, duorum cubitorum et dimidii in longitudine, et cubiti ac semis in latitudine.

verses.textEn: and then two Cherubim of ductile gold, which he positioned at the two sides of the propitiatory:
verses.textLa: Duos etiam Cherubim ex auro ductili, quos posuit ex utraque parte propitiatorii:

verses.textEn: one Cherub at the top of one side, and the other Cherub at the top of the other side. The two Cherubim were at each end of the propitiatory,
verses.textLa: Cherub unum in summitate unius partis, et Cherub alterum in summitate partis alterius: duos Cherubim in singulis summitatibus propitiatorii,

verses.textEn: spreading their wings, and protecting the propitiatory, and gazing toward it and toward one another.
verses.textLa: extendentes alas, et tegentes propitiatorium, seque mutuo et illud respicientes.

verses.textEn: He also made the table from setim wood, with a length of two cubits, and a width of one cubit, which had a height of one and one half cubits.
verses.textLa: Fecit et mensam de lignis setim, in longitudine duorum cubitorum, et in latitudine unius cubiti, quæ habebat in altitudine cubitum ac semissem.

verses.textEn: And he surrounded it with the finest gold, and for it he made a ledge of gold all around,
verses.textLa: Circumdeditque eam auro mundissimo, et fecit illi labium aureum per gyrum,

verses.textEn: and for the ledge itself he made a polished crown of gold, four fingers high, and upon the same, another crown of gold.
verses.textLa: ipsique labio coronam auream interrasilem quattuor digitorum, et super eamdem, alteram coronam auream.

verses.textEn: And he cast four gold rings, which he set at the four corners at each foot of the table,
verses.textLa: Fudit et quattuor circulos aureos, quos posuit in quattuor angulis per singulos pedes mensæ

verses.textEn: opposite the crown. And he placed the bars into them, so that the table could be carried.
verses.textLa: contra coronam: misitque in eos vectes, ut possit mensa portari.

verses.textEn: Likewise, the bars themselves he made from setim wood, and he surrounded them with gold.
verses.textLa: Ipsos quoque vectes fecit de lignis setim, et circumdedit eos auro.

verses.textEn: And he made vessels for the diverse uses of the table, as well as the little cups, and bowls, and measuring cups, and the censers, from pure gold, in which the libations would be offered.
verses.textLa: Et vasa ad diversos usus mensæ, acetabula, phialas, et cyathos, et thuribula, ex auro puro, in quibus offerenda sunt libamina.

verses.textEn: He also made the lampstand, formed from the finest gold. The branches, bowls, and little spheres, as well as the lilies, proceeded from its bar:
verses.textLa: Fecit et candelabrum ductile de auro mundissimo. De cuius vecte calami, scyphi, sphærulæque ac lilia procedebant:

verses.textEn: six on the two sides, three branches on one side, and three on the other.
verses.textLa: sex in utroque latere, tres calami ex parte una, et tres ex altera:

verses.textEn: Three bowls, the size of a nut, were on each branch, with little spheres and lilies, and three bowls, in the likeness of a nut, were on the other branch, with the little spheres together with the lilies. The workmanship of the six branches, which proceeded from the shaft of the lampstand, was equal.
verses.textLa: tres scyphi in nucis modum per calamos singulos, sphærulæque simul et lilia: et tres scyphi instar nucis in calamo altero, sphærulæque simul et lilia. Æquum erat opus sex calamorum, qui procedebant de stipite candelabri.

verses.textEn: Now on the shaft itself were four bowls, the size of a nut, and little spheres together with each one, and lilies,
verses.textLa: In ipso autem vecte erant quattuor scyphi in nucis modum, sphærulæque per singulos simul et lilia:

verses.textEn: and little spheres under two branches in three places, which together made six branches proceeding from one bar.
verses.textLa: et sphærulæ sub duobus calamis per loca tria, qui simul sex fiunt calami procedentes de vecte uno.
verses.notes: The bar ‘vecte’ appears to be different than the shaft ‘stipite.’ I think that the bar is horizontal and the shaft vertical.

verses.textEn: Thus, both the little spheres and the branches were from the same thing: all hand-worked from the purest gold.
verses.textLa: Et sphærulæ igitur, et calami ex ipso erant, universa ductilia ex auro purissimo.

verses.textEn: He also made the seven lamps with their candle snuffers, and the vessels where the candles would be extinguished, from the finest gold.
verses.textLa: Fecit et lucernas septem cum emunctoriis suis, et vasa ubi ea quæ emuncta sunt, extinguantur, de auro mundissimo.

verses.textEn: The lampstand with all its vessels weighed a talent of gold.
verses.textLa: Talentum auri appendebat candelabrum cum omnibus vasis suis.
verses.notes: A talent of gold is about 66 pounds.

verses.textEn: He also made the altar of incense from setim wood, having one cubit on each of four sides, and in height, two. From its corners proceeded horns.
verses.textLa: Fecit et altare thymiamatis de lignis setim, per quadrum singulos habens cubitos, et in altitudine duos: e cuius angulis procedebant cornua.

verses.textEn: And he clothed it with the purest gold, with its grating, as well as the sides and the horns.
verses.textLa: Vestivitque illud auro purissimo cum craticula ac parietibus et cornibus.

verses.textEn: And for it he made a crown of gold all around, and two gold rings under the crown at each side, so that the bars might be put into them, and the altar could be carried.
verses.textLa: Fecitque ei coronam aureolam per gyrum, et duos annulos aureos sub corona per singula latera, ut mittantur in eos vectes, et possit altare portari.

verses.textEn: Now the bars themselves he also made from setim wood, and he covered them with layers of gold.
verses.textLa: Ipsos autem vectes fecit de lignis setim, et operuit laminis aureis.

verses.textEn: He also composed the oil for the ointment of sanctification, and the incense, from the purest aromatics, with the skill of a perfumer.
verses.textLa: Composuit et oleum ad sanctificationis unguentum, et thymiama de aromatibus mundissimis opere pigmentarii.
verses.notes: The word ‘pigmentarii’ refers to someone who makes and sells paints, cosmetics, and ointments.

verses.textEn: He also made the altar of holocaust from setim wood: five cubits square, and three in height,
verses.textLa: Fecit et altare holocausti de lignis setim, quinque cubitorum per quadrum, et trium in altitudine:

verses.textEn: the horns of which proceeded from the corners. And he covered it with layers of brass.
verses.textLa: cuius cornua de angulis procedebant, operuitque illum laminis æneis.

verses.textEn: And for its uses, he prepared diverse vessels out of brass: kettles, forceps, little hooks, larger hooks, and receptacles for the fire.
verses.textLa: Et in usus eius paravit ex ære vasa diversa, lebetes, forcipes, fuscinulas, uncinos, et ignium receptacula.
verses.notes: The word ‘fuscinulas’ refers to smaller hooks, sometimes with three hooks joined; the word ‘uncinos’ refers to a single larger hook.

verses.textEn: And he made its grating of brass, in the manner of a net, and under it, in the midst of the altar, its base,
verses.textLa: Craticulamque eius in modum retis fecit æneam, et subter eam in altaris medio arulam,

verses.textEn: casting four rings at the four ends of the net in order to set the bars, so as to carry it.
verses.textLa: fusis quattuor annulis per totidem retiaculi summitates, ad immittendos vectes ad portandum:

verses.textEn: These bars he also made of setim wood, and he covered them with layers of brass.
verses.textLa: quos et ipsos fecit de lignis setim, et operuit laminis æneis:

verses.textEn: And he drew them through the rings, which projected from the sides of the altar. But the altar itself was not solid, but hollow, made from panels and empty inside.
verses.textLa: induxitque in circulos, qui in lateribus altaris eminebant. Ipsum autem altare non erat solidum, sed cavum ex tabulis, et intus vacuum.

verses.textEn: He also made the washtub of brass, with its base made from the mirrors of the women who kept watch at the door of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: Fecit et labrum æneum cum basi sua de speculis mulierum, quæ excubabant in ostio tabernaculi.
verses.notes: The women at the door of the tabernacle had mirrors with them, probably so that they could look into the tabernacle. They were not allowed to enter the tabernacle. This may have been the Tabernacle that was being worked on, for the parts would have to be assembled to assure that they were made to the correct specifications. Or it may have been the existing tent which held the ark and the tablets of the testimony prior to the building of the Tabernacle.

verses.textEn: He also made the atrium, at the south side of which were hangings of fine twisted linen of one hundred cubits and
verses.textLa: Fecit et atrium, in cuius australi plaga erant tentoria de bysso retorta, cubitorum centum,

verses.textEn: twenty columns of brass with their bases. The heads of the columns and all of the engraving work were of silver.
verses.textLa: columnæ æneæ viginti cum basibus suis, capita columnarum, et tota operis cælatura, argentea.

verses.textEn: Equally, at the northern area, the hangings, the columns, and the bases and heads of the columns were of the same measure and work and metal.
verses.textLa: Æque ad septentrionalem plagam tentoria, columnæ, basesque et capita columarum eiusdem mensuræ, et operis ac metalli, erant.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, on that side which looks out toward the west, there were hangings of fifty cubits, and ten columns with their bases of brass. And the heads of the columns and all of the engraving work were of silver.
verses.textLa: In ea vero plaga, quæ ad Occidentem respicit, fuerunt tentoria cubitorum quinquaginta, columnæ decem cum basibus suis æneæ, et capita columnarum, et tota operis cælatura, argentea.

verses.textEn: Furthermore, toward the east, he prepared hangings of fifty cubits:
verses.textLa: Porro contra orientem quinquaginta cubitorum paravit tentoria:

verses.textEn: of which, there were fifteen cubits, among three columns with their bases, holding up one side,
verses.textLa: e quibus, quindecim cubitos columnarum trium, cum basibus suis unum tenebat latus:

verses.textEn: and on the other side, (for between the two he made the entrance of the tabernacle) there were equally hangings of fifteen cubits, and three pillars, and the same number of bases.
verses.textLa: et in parte altera (quia inter utraque introitum tabernaculi fecit) quindecim æque cubitorum erant tentoria, columnæque tres, et bases totidem.
verses.notes: The Temple of Jerusalem was a symbol and foreshadowing of the Christ. The Tabernacle that prepared for the Temple was a symbol and foreshadowing of the Virgin Mary.

verses.textEn: All the hangings of the atrium were woven from fine twisted linen.
verses.textLa: Cuncta atrii tentoria byssus retorta texuerat.

verses.textEn: The bases of the columns were of brass, but their heads with all of their engravings were of silver. Now he also overlaid the columns of the atrium themselves with silver.
verses.textLa: Bases columnarum fuere æneæ, capita autem earum cum cunctis cælaturis suis argentea: sed et ipsas columnas atrii vestivit argento.

verses.textEn: And he made, at its entrance, a hanging, wrought with embroidery, of hyacinth, purple, vermillion, and fine twisted linen, which held twenty cubits in length, yet truly it was five cubits in height, as with the measure of all the hangings of the atrium.
verses.textLa: Et in introitu eius opere plumario fecit tentorium ex hyacintho, purpura, vermiculo, ac bysso retorta, quod habebat viginti cubitos in longitudine, altitudo vero quinque cubitorum erat iuxta mensuram, quam cuncta atrii tentoria habebant.

verses.textEn: Now the columns at the entrance were four, with bases of brass, and their heads and engravings were of silver.
verses.textLa: Columnæ autem in ingressu fuere quattuor cum basibus æneis, capitaque earum et cælaturæ argenteæ.

verses.textEn: Likewise, the tent pegs of the tabernacle and the atrium all around he made of brass.
verses.textLa: Paxillos quoque tabernaculi et atrii per gyrum fecit æneos.

verses.textEn: These are the instruments of the tabernacle of the testimony, which were enumerated according to the instruction of Moses, with the ceremonies of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest,
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt instrumena tabernaculi testimonii, quæ enumerata sunt iuxta præceptum Moysi in cæremoniis Levitarum per manum Ithamar filii Aaron sacerdotis:

verses.textEn: which Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur from the tribe of Judah, had completed, just as the Lord decreed through Moses.
verses.textLa: quæ Beseleel filius Uri filii Hur de tribu Iuda, Domino per Moysen iubente, compleverat,

verses.textEn: He was joined by his associate, Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan, who himself was also an exceptional artisan of wood, and of weaving, as well as of embroidery, with hyacinth, purple, vermillion, and fine linen.
verses.textLa: iuncto sibi socio Ooliab filio Achisamech de tribu Dan: qui et ipse artifex lignorum egregius fuit, et polymitarius atque plumarius ex hyacintho, purpura, vermiculo, et bysso.

verses.textEn: All of the gold that was expended in the work of the Sanctuary, and that was offered in donation, was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels, according to the measure of the Sanctuary.
verses.textLa: Omne aurum quod expensum est in opere Sanctuarii, et quod oblatum est in donariis, viginti novem talentorum fuit, et septingentorum triginta siclorum ad mensuram Sanctuarii.
verses.notes: This was about 2,000 pounds of gold. Almost all of this gold came from the Egyptians (who gave it to the Israelites as they were leaving), for the Israelites possessed very little during their servitude in Egypt.

verses.textEn: Now it was offered by those who were past the numbering of twenty years and above: from six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty men able to bear arms.
verses.textLa: Oblatum est autem ab his qui transierunt ad numerum a viginti annis et supra, de sexcentis tribus millibus, et quingentis quinquaginta, armatorum.

verses.textEn: There were, beyond that, one hundred talents of silver, from which were cast the bases for the Sanctuary and for the entrance where the veil hangs.
verses.textLa: Fuerunt præterea centum talenta argenti, e quibus conflatæ sunt bases Sanctuarii, et introitus ubi velum pendet.

verses.textEn: One hundred bases were made from one hundred talents, a single talent being counted for each base.
verses.textLa: Centum bases factæ sunt de talentis centum, singulis talentis per bases singulas supputatis.

verses.textEn: But from one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five, he made the heads of the columns, which he also clothed with silver.
verses.textLa: De mille autem septingentis, et septuaginta quinque fecit capita columnarum, quas et ipsas vestivit argento.
verses.notes: It is not clear whether this weight refers to talents or to shekels. If the silver refers only to the silver at the heads of the columns, then it would be shekels.

verses.textEn: Likewise, of brass, there was offered seventy-two thousand talents, and four hundred more shekels,
verses.textLa: Æris quoque oblata sunt talenta septuaginta duo millia, et quadringenti supra sicli,

verses.textEn: from which were cast the bases at the entrance of the tabernacle of the testimony, and the altar of brass with its grating, and the vessels which pertain to its use,
verses.textLa: ex quibus fusæ sunt bases in introitu tabernaculi testimonii, et altare æneum cum craticula sua, omniaque vasa, quæ ad usum eius pertinent,

verses.textEn: and the bases of the atrium, as much at the circumference as at its entrance, and the tent pegs of the tabernacle and of the atrium all round.
verses.textLa: et bases atrii tam in circuitu quam in ingressu eius, et paxilli tabernaculi atque atrii, per gyrum.

verses.textEn: Truly, from hyacinth and purple, vermillion and fine linen, he made the vestments with which Aaron was clothed when he ministered in the holy places, just as the Lord instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: De hyacintho vero et purpura, vermiculo ac bysso fecit vestes, quibus indueretur Aaron quando ministrabat in sanctis, sicut præcepit Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And so he made an ephod of gold, hyacinth, and purple, and twice-dyed scarlet, and fine twisted linen,
verses.textLa: Fecit igitur superhumerale de auro, hyacintho, et purpura, coccoque bis tincto, et bysso retorta,

verses.textEn: wrought with embroidery. And he cut thin strips of gold and drew them into threads, so that they could be twisted into the weave of the first colors.
verses.textLa: opere polymitario, inciditque bracteas aureas, et extenuavit in fila, ut possent torqueri cum priorum colorum subtegmine,

verses.textEn: And he made two edges, coupled to one another at the top of both sides,
verses.textLa: duasque oras sibi invicem copulatas in utroque latere summitatum,

verses.textEn: and a wide belt from the same colors, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: et balteum ex eisdem coloribus, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: He also prepared two onyx stones, set and enclosed in gold, and engraved with the skill of a jeweler, with the names of the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Paravit et duos lapides onychinos, astrictos et inclusos auro, et sculptos arte gemmaria, nominibus filiorum Israel:

verses.textEn: And he set them in the sides of the ephod, as a memorial to the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: posuitque eos in lateribus superhumeralis in monimentum filiorum Israel, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: He also made a breastplate, wrought with embroidery, according to the work of the ephod, from gold, hyacinth, purple, and twice-dyed scarlet, and fine twisted linen:
verses.textLa: Fecit et rationale opere polymito iuxta opus superhumeralis, ex auro, hyacintho, purpura, coccoque bis tincto, et bysso retorta:

verses.textEn: with four equal sides, doubled, of the measure of the palm of a hand.
verses.textLa: quadrangulum, duplex, mensuræ palmi.

verses.textEn: And he set four rows of gems in it. In the first row was a sardius stone, a topaz, an emerald;
verses.textLa: Et posuit in eo gemmarum ordines quattuor. In primo versu erat sardius, topazius, smaragdus.

verses.textEn: in the second was a garnet, a sapphire, and a jasper;
verses.textLa: In secundo, carbunculus, sapphirus, et iaspis.

verses.textEn: in the third was a zircon, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.textLa: In tertio, ligurius, achates, et amethystus.

verses.textEn: in the fourth was a chrysolite, an onyx, and a beryl, surrounded and enclosed in gold by their rows.
verses.textLa: In quarto, chrysolithus, onychinus, et beryllus, circumdati et inclusi auro per ordines suos.

verses.textEn: And these twelve stones were engraved with the names of the twelve tribes of Israel, each one with a single name.
verses.textLa: Ipsique lapides duodecim, sculpti erant nominibus duodecim tribuum Israel, singuli per nomina singulorum.

verses.textEn: They also made, in the breastplate, little chains linked to one another, from the purest gold,
verses.textLa: Fecerunt in rationali et catenulas sibi invicem cohærentes, de auro purissimo:

verses.textEn: and two hooks, and the same number of gold rings. Moreover, they set the rings at both sides of the breastplate,
verses.textLa: et duos uncinos, totidemque annulos aureos. Porro annulos posuerunt in utroque latere rationalis,

verses.textEn: from which two golden chains would hang, which they connected with the hooks that projected from the corners of the ephod.
verses.textLa: e quibus penderent duæ catenæ aureæ, quas inseruerunt uncinis, qui in superhumeralis angulis eminebant.

verses.textEn: These were both in front and in back so that they met one another, and so that the ephod and the breastplate were woven together,
verses.textLa: Hæc et ante et retro ita conveniebant sibi, ut superhumerale et rationale mutuo necterentur,

verses.textEn: being fastened to the wide belt and strongly coupled with rings, to which a hyacinth band was joined, lest they should shake loose and be moved away from one another, just as the Lord instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: stricta ad balteum et annulis fortius copulata, quos iungebat vitta hyacinthina, ne laxa fluerent, et a se invicem moverentur, sicut præcepit Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: They also made the tunic of the ephod entirely from hyacinth,
verses.textLa: Feceruntque quoque tunicam superhumeralis totam hyacinthinam,

verses.textEn: with the head in the upper part at the middle, and a woven edge all around the head.
verses.textLa: et capitium in superiori parte contra medium, oramque per gyrum capitii textilem:

verses.textEn: Then, at the feet below, they also made pomegranates from hyacinth, purple, vermillion, and fine twisted linen,
verses.textLa: deorsum autem ad pedes mala punica ex hyacintho, purpura, vermiculo, ac bysso retorta:

verses.textEn: and little bells from the purest gold, which they set between the pomegranates at the very bottom of the tunic all around.
verses.textLa: et tintinnabula de auro purissimo, quæ posuerunt inter malogranata in extrema parte tunicæ per gyrum:

verses.textEn: So then, the high priest approached, adorned with gold bell and pomegranate, when he performed his ministry, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: tintinnabulum autem aureum, et malum punicum, quibus ornatus incedebat pontifex quando ministerio fungebatur, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: They also made fine linen tunics with woven work, for Aaron and his sons,
verses.textLa: Fecerunt et tunicas byssinas opere textili Aaron et filiis eius:

verses.textEn: and headdresses with their little crowns of fine linen,
verses.textLa: et mitras cum coronulis suis ex bysso:

verses.textEn: and also linen undergarments of fine linen.
verses.textLa: feminalia quoque linea, byssina:

verses.textEn: Truly, they also made a wide band of fine twisted linen, hyacinth, purple, as well as vermillion, twice-dyed, with skillful embroidery, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: cingulum vero de bysso retorta, hyacintho, purpura, ac vermiculo bis tincto arte plumaria, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: They also made the plate of sacred veneration from the purest gold, and they wrote on it, with the skill of a jeweler: “Holy to the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Fecerunt et laminam sacræ venerationis de auro purissimo, scripseruntque in ea opere gemmario, Sanctum Domini:

verses.textEn: And they fastened it to the headdress with a hyacinth band, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: et strinxerunt eam cum mitra vitta hyacinthina, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And so all the work of the tabernacle and of the covering of the testimony was completed. And the sons of Israel did all that the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: Perfectum est igitur omne opus tabernaculi et tecti testimonii: feceruntque filii Israel cuncta quæ præceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.notes: The covering of the ark of the testimony was apparently the last object to be completed. This makes sense because the work of making two large Cherubim out of pure gold must have been very difficult and must have required the most skill and time.

verses.textEn: And they offered the tabernacle, and the covering, and all of the articles: the rings, the panels, the bars, the columns and bases,
verses.textLa: Et obtulerunt tabernaculum et tectum et universam supellectilem, annulos, tabulas, vectes, columnas ac bases,

verses.textEn: the cover of the skins of rams, dyed red, and the other cover of violet skins,
verses.textLa: opertorium de pellibus arietum rubricatis, et aliud operimentum de ianthinis pellibus:

verses.textEn: the veil, the ark, the bars, the propitiatory,
verses.textLa: velum, arcam, vectes, propitiatorium:

verses.textEn: the table, with its vessels and the bread of the presence,
verses.textLa: mensam cum vasis suis et propositionis panibus:

verses.textEn: the lampstand, the lamps, and their utensils with the oil,
verses.textLa: candelabrum, lucernas, et utensilia earum cum oleo:

verses.textEn: the altar of gold, and the ointment, and the incense of aromatics,
verses.textLa: altare aureum, et unguentum, et thymiama ex aromatibus:

verses.textEn: and the tent at the entrance of the tabernacle,
verses.textLa: et tentorium in introitu tabernaculi:

verses.textEn: the altar of brass, the grating, the bars, and all of its vessels, the washtub with its base, the hangings of the atrium, and the columns with their bases,
verses.textLa: altare æneum, retiaculum, vectes, et vasa eius omnia: labrum cum basi sua: tentoria atrii, et columnas cum basibus suis:

verses.textEn: the hanging at the entrance of the atrium, and their little cords and pegs. Nothing was lacking of the articles that were commanded to be made for the ministry of the tabernacle and for the covering of the covenant.
verses.textLa: tentorium in introitu atrii, funiculosque illius et paxillos. Nihil ex vasis defuit, quæ in ministerium tabernaculi, et in tectum fœderis iussa sunt fieri.

verses.textEn: Likewise, the vestments, which the priests, namely, Aaron and his sons, make use of use in the Sanctuary,
verses.textLa: Vestes quoque, quibus sacerdotes utuntur in Sanctuario, Aaron scilicet et filii eius,

verses.textEn: the sons of Israel offered, just as the Lord had instructed.
verses.textLa: obtulerunt filii Israel, sicut præceperat Dominus.

verses.textEn: After this, when Moses saw that everything was completed, he blessed them.
verses.textLa: Quæ postquam Moyses cuncta vidit completa, benedixit eis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “In the first month, on the first day of the month, you shall raise the tabernacle of the testimony,
verses.textLa: Mense primo, prima die mensis, eriges tabernaculum testimonii,
verses.notes: The Israelites would have had to partially assemble the Tabernacle of the Testimony in advance of this date, as they were building its components, in order to assure that it was made to the correct size and shape.

verses.textEn: and you shall place the ark in it, and you shall release the veil before it.
verses.textLa: et pones in eo arcam, dimittesque ante illam velum:

verses.textEn: And having brought in the table, you shall place the things which were solemnly commanded upon it. The lampstand shall stand with its lamps,
verses.textLa: et illata mensa, pones super eam quæ rite præcepta sunt. Candelabrum stabit cum lucernis suis,

verses.textEn: and the altar of gold, in which the incense is burned, shall stand before the ark of the testimony. You shall place the tent at the entrance of the tabernacle,
verses.textLa: et altare aureum in quo adoletur incensum, coram arca testimonii. Tentorium in introitu tabernaculi pones,

verses.textEn: and before it, the altar of holocaust.
verses.textLa: et ante illud altare holocausti:

verses.textEn: The washtub shall stand between the altar and the tabernacle, and you shall fill it with water.
verses.textLa: labrum inter altare et tabernaculum, quod implebis aqua.

verses.textEn: And you shall encompass the atrium and its entrance with hangings.
verses.textLa: Circumdabisque atrium tentoriis, et ingressum eius.

verses.textEn: And, having taken up the oil of unction, you shall anoint the tabernacle along with its articles, so that they may be sanctified.
verses.textLa: Et assumpto unctionis oleo unges tabernaculum cum vasis suis, ut sanctificentur:

verses.textEn: The altar of holocaust and all its vessels,
verses.textLa: altare holocausti et omnia vasa eius:

verses.textEn: the washtub with its base, and all things, you shall consecrate with the oil of unction, so that they may be the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: labrum cum basi sua: omnia unctionis oleo consecrabis, ut sint Sancta sanctorum.

verses.textEn: And you shall bring forward Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tabernacle of the testimony, and, having washed them with water,
verses.textLa: Applicabisque Aaron et filios eius ad fores tabernaculi testimonii, et lotos aqua

verses.textEn: you shall clothe them in the holy vestments, so that they may minister to me, and so that their unction may accomplish an everlasting priesthood.”
verses.textLa: indues sanctis vestibus, ut ministrent mihi, et unctio eorum in sacerdotium sempiternum proficiat.

verses.textEn: And Moses did all that the Lord had instructed.
verses.textLa: Fecitque Moyses omnia quæ præceperat Dominus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, in the first month of the second year, on the first day of the month, the tabernacle was put in place.
verses.textLa: Igitur mense primo anni secundi, prima die mensis, collocatum est tabernaculum.

verses.textEn: And Moses raised it up, and he positioned the panels as well as the bases and the bars, and he set up the columns,
verses.textLa: Erexitque Moyses illud, et posuit tabulas ac bases et vectes, statuitque columnas,

verses.textEn: and he stretched out the roof over the tabernacle, imposing a cover above it, just as the Lord had decreed.
verses.textLa: et expandit tectum super tabernaculum, imposito desuper operimento, sicut Dominus imperaverat.

verses.textEn: And he placed the testimony in the ark, applying the bars beneath, and the oracle above.
verses.textLa: Posuit et testimonium in arca, subditis infra vectibus, et oraculum desuper.

verses.textEn: And when he had brought the ark into the tabernacle, he drew the veil before it, in order to fulfill the commandment of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Cumque intulisset arcam in tabernaculum, appendit ante eam velum ut expleret Domini iussionem.

verses.textEn: And he placed the table in the tabernacle of the testimony, at the north side, beyond the veil,
verses.textLa: Posuit et mensam in tabernaculo testimonii ad plagam Septentrionalem extra velum,

verses.textEn: arranging before it the bread of the presence, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: ordinatis coram propositionis panibus, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And he placed the lampstand in the tabernacle of the testimony, away from the table, on the south side,
verses.textLa: Posuit et candelabrum in tabernaculo testimonii e regione mensæ in parte australi,

verses.textEn: setting the lamps in order, according to the precept of the Lord.
verses.textLa: locatis per ordinem lucernis, iuxta præceptum Domini.

verses.textEn: He also positioned the altar of gold under the roof of the testimony, opposite the veil,
verses.textLa: Posuit et altare aureum sub tecto testimonii contra velum,

verses.textEn: and he heaped upon it the incense of aromatics, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.textLa: et adolevit super eo incensum aromatum, sicut iusserat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And he positioned the tent at the entrance of the tabernacle of the testimony,
verses.textLa: Posuit et tentorium in introitu tabernaculi testimonii,

verses.textEn: and the altar of holocaust in the vestibule of the testimony, offering the holocaust and the sacrifices upon it, just as the Lord had decreed.
verses.textLa: et altare holocausti in vestibulo testimonii, offerens in eo holocaustum, et sacrificia, ut Dominus imperaverat.

verses.textEn: Likewise, he stationed the washtub between the tabernacle of the testimony and the altar, filling it with water.
verses.textLa: Labrum quoque statuit inter tabernaculum testimonii et altare, implens illud aqua.

verses.textEn: And Moses and Aaron, along with his sons, washed their hands and feet,
verses.textLa: Laveruntque Moyses et Aaron, ac filii eius manus suas et pedes,

verses.textEn: whenever they would enter the covering of the covenant, and when they approached to the altar, just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: cum ingrederentur tectum fœderis, et accederent ad altare, sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And he raised up the atrium around the tabernacle and the altar, drawing the hanging at its entrance. After all these things were perfected,
verses.textLa: Erexit et atrium per gyrum tabernaculi et altaris, ducto in introitu eius tentorio. Postquam omnia perfecta sunt,

verses.textEn: the cloud covered the tabernacle of the testimony, and the glory of the Lord filled it.
verses.textLa: operuit nubes tabernaculum testimonii, et gloria Domini implevit illud.

verses.textEn: Neither could Moses enter the covering of the covenant: the cloud was covering all things, and the majesty of the Lord was flashing. For the cloud had covered everything.
verses.textLa: Nec poterat Moyses ingredi tectum fœderis, nube operiente omnia, et maiestate Domini coruscante, quia cuncta nubes operuerat.

verses.textEn: Whenever the cloud departed from the tabernacle, the sons of Israel set out by their companies.
verses.textLa: Si quando nubes tabernaculum deserebat, proficiscebantur filii Israel per turmas suas:

verses.textEn: But if it remained hanging over it, they remained in the same place.
verses.textLa: si pendebat desuper, manebant in eodem loco.

verses.textEn: Certainly, the cloud of the Lord lay over the tabernacle by day, and the fire by night, being seen by all the people of Israel throughout all their resting places.
verses.textLa: Nubes quippe Domini incubabat per diem tabernaculo, et ignis in nocte, videntibus cunctis populis Israel per cunctas mansiones suas.
verses.notes: The implication of the word ‘mansiones’ is that the Israelites were on the move, so that the word ‘mansiones’ refers to whatever place at which they were temporarily residing.
